Communication skills with all levels and team-work spirits are essential.

job_description:
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs
The DevOps operating model is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that helps organizations deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. The Senior DevOps Consultant is a leader with significant automation and programming experience throughout the SDLC. The Consultant will lead our enterprise customers through large organizational and SDLC transformations. A successful DevOps practitioner has technical depth across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovations. Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants may be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic qualifications
8+ years of experience as a technical specialist.
Familiarity with administrative tasks within popular operating systems.
Hands-on experience with architecting and automated provisioning (IaC), configuration management for infrastructure and applications.
Hands-on experience with envisioning, designing, building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools.
Strong hands-on experience with mainline programming and scripting languages such as Shell, Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, .Net, or C++.
Experience establishing, implementing, and delivering using Agile practices.
Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience.
Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services as needed.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with CloudFormation, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.
Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall.
Experience with monitoring and log aggregating frameworks like CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Opentracing, AWS X-Ray, and APM tools.
Experience with development and automated testing.
Understanding of microservices and distributed application architecture.
Experience building enterprise security strategy for cloud adoption or driving the program's evolution to meet new requirements.
Experience leading the certification or accreditation of cloud workload(s) to meet industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks.
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations and engagements.

At AWS, we're hiring experienced consultants with a background in enterprise call centers to help our enterprise customers understand, plan and implement best practices around migrating, building, managing and operating Amazon Connect within their AWS cloud environments. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, re-usable artifacts, reference architectures, and lead implementation projects to assist some of the world's leading enterprises transform their call centers to Amazon Connect and the AWS platform.

We're looking for someone who is passionate about:
Working on the cutting edge of innovative AWS products and services
Maintaining domain knowledge and expertise in enterprise call centers, workforce management, Artificial Intelligence and CRM platforms
Implementing and extending frameworks and methodologies commonly used by enterprises to assess, migrate, and transform the call center experience
Architecting and building large-scale solutions, which integrate smoothly in cloud and hybrid operating models for supporting Amazon Connect
Providing guidance on the people, organizational, security and compliance aspects of transforming the contact center to the Cloud
Setting-up and configuring AWS services in-line with best practices
Coaching customers and partner teams to be self-sufficient
Responsibilities include:
Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn how to build and move to production grade AWS environments that support Amazon Connect
Solutions - Define and deliver on-site Professional Services engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements, specifically focused on call center organization, processes, tooling and integration. Software development experience with building contact center integrations is a plus.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include integration and adaption of existing enterprise call centers into Amazon Connect.
Insights - Work with AWS product, engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Contribute to best practice in the form of whitepapers and playbooks.

10+ years of experience as a contact center technology architect, enterprise IT Architect or senior contact center developer working with leading contact center technology platforms and applications, such as Avaya, Cisco, Genesys, Verint, NICE, Salesforce, etc.

Hands-on experience working on the design, development and deployment of contact center solutions at scale

Professional Services or Consulting experience in highly-visible customer-facing roles

job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, and headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Sourced Group is the market leader in providing cloud transformation services to the most highly regulated, security-conscious organizations globally. With operations in Australia, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, New Zealand, and the United States, we work with the Global 200 to drive business transformation through the cloud and I.T. services. Sourced Group is an AWS Premier Partner, Microsoft Azure Gold Managed Partner, Google Premier Partner and have worked with extensive financial services and regulated enterprises such as the top banks in Canada, Australia and Singapore, as well as airlines and telecommunications companies. After recent successes, Sourced Group is continuing to expand its footprint around the world. Sourced was acquired this year by Amdocs.
Sourced Values
Here at Sourced, we are committed to providing a rewarding, enjoyable, balanced workplace and career path for our employees. We value authentic, self-driven people, who aspire to grow personally and professionally, and are committed to delivering excellence in all areas.
Our company Values are Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, and Sustainability.
Role
The Lead Delivery Consultant position offers an excellent career and growth opportunity for a talented and highly-motivated professional with significant prior experience in operations, management consulting and technical cloud operations. This role is part of a newly formed Solutions Enablement team in Singapore.
Sourced is a company that makes a tremendous impact and has specific knowledge and experience working in sophisticated, often complicated, and generally extensive, regulated environments. Our people are fearless and work in partnership with both client leadership and engineering teams to build world-class public cloud solutions in regulated and security-conscious verticals.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Enablement, this newly created position is responsible for leading agile cloud transformation projects for customers in ASEAN.
As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we need passionate leaders to help our largest customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud platform operations. You will work one-on-one with our top-tier customers and partners, supporting not only the software development lifecycle as it applies to the cloud services but also the operations management of active services, and business relationships between the Customer, Sourced Group, and partners (such as Microsoft, AWS, and application development partners).
As a Lead Agile Delivery Consultant, you will be the primary operational point of contact for one or more customers, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business-critical applications. Whilst this role is business-focused, you will coordinate technical teams to deliver enterprise public cloud projects (with AWS, Azure and GCP).
You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers to build mature, stable and secure operational cloud platforms. You will leverage your broad experience in management consulting focusing on the delivery of large-scale projects across industries such as Finance, Consumer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications.
You will also be responsible for driving Cloud change program into our clients and develop the Governance and Change Management offerings.
With your team of Delivery consultants, you will be our Cloud Consultants and Site leads advocate and you will support their workload by managing timelines, scope and customers expectations. You must possess customer-facing skills that enable you to represent the Sourced team, our capabilities, and our services within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. Each day will bring new challenges to which you will need to adapt and respond. Customer centricity, tenacity, and a sense of urgency will all contribute to your success in this role. You will:
Act with a sense of urgency, be agile and pragmatic, and foster cross-team collaboration;
Support the Head of Solutions Enablement, Head of Consulting and Head of Sales assist with account management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations with clients, and manage resource allocation
Supervise technical issues resolution, work directly with your team of delivery consultants, as well as escalate to subject-matter experts, and work directly with the cloud service provider(s) (GCP, AWS and Azure) to ensure customer issues are mitigated and resolved in an expeditious manner;
Facilitate discussions to ensure solutions are designed for long term successful deployment and operational stability;
As required, define I.T. and business processes and tools that work well with customers expectations to streamline the performance of the services which we provide;
Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans, as well as to provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, and detailed prelaunch planning;
Analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership, as well as roadmap and service improvement plans;
Desired Skills and Experience
While specific responsibilities will vary based on previous experience, to be successful in the role, the ideal candidate will have the following:
8 years plus of relevant experience in I.T. operations, consulting or related industry experience in digital transformation, preferably in verticals such as Financial services, Telecommunications or the Public sector.
Familiarity with Enterprise operations including ITSM, ITIL v3+, as well as SAFe/Scaled Agile and Agile product ownership & management (Scrum, Kanban, Sprints etc)
A natural problem-solving mindset, be detail-oriented with a creative flair and a bias for action
Relevant experience in project-based, team-oriented environments and a track record of leading or working in teams and delivering against tight deadlines in fast-paced and demanding environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to conduct and leverage sophisticated analyses to identify trends, draw conclusions and present recommendations.
Outstanding facilitation and communication skills; confidence in presenting to senior executives.
Graduate or advanced degree from a top academic program, ideally being a Bachelor's or Master degree in Business, Information Technology, or related field;
A thorough understanding of staffing, capacity planning, and performance engagement for internal teams
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Change Management principles as applied to service delivery in an international setting would be highly regarded.
Ability to lead scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases
If possible, the candidate would have large programs transformation experience, including cloud compliance, security and risk experience in regulated industries, especially the Financial and Services Industry.
Basic understanding of cloud computing. Understanding of DevOps practices would be a plus.
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. job_title: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
tech_stack: Scalability  Azure  Cloud Computing  Vmware  Vblock  Google Cloud Platform  Saas  Virtualization  CRM  Customer Experience  experimentation  Customer Contact  Sales Engineering  Advocacy  Audit
job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life.
The role: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
Our team inspires leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like G Suite, Search, and Chrome. You reach out proactively to show customers how Google Cloud solutions can help them become more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
Additional Role Description:
The Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales team focuses on business development in relation to small and medium-sized businesses, a critical segment for the Cloud business. The Sales team's priority is to maximize business growth from the SMB segment, predominantly through strategic pitching and advocacy, and cultivation of partners. The team also participates in research and experimentation with data-driven, scalable solutions intended to improve conversion rate and customer lifetime value.
As a Sales Representative focused on the Indonesian Market, you are an expert blend of sales, technology and strategy. Much of your time will be spent talking with customers, discussing and advocating for the value of Google Cloud solutions, particularly Google Workspace. In addition to having a passion for sales, you also possess analytical and creative skills. As you talk with many customers and partners each month, you will have ideas for how we can improve our product or enhance the customer experience.
In this role, you will manage new initiatives or experiments, while also using your ability to manage stakeholders across many different functional teams in order to execute quickly and to drive success. You will also work to develop the business growth of your assigned territory through campaigns, partner development and marketing events.
Responsibilities:
- Manage opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary. Serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption-related activities.
- Deliver against assigned strategic goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our customers.
- Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
- Work with our Sales Engineers and trusted Google Cloud Partners as a critical member of the Sales team in order to maximize business results and to cultivate opportunities with small and medium businesses.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience discussing platform and infrastructure-as-a-service
- Experience with the cloud computing market.
- Educate and advocate for Google and our products when presenting to Bahasa-speaking clients and agencies on new products, campaign results, and performance.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce.com). Demonstrated track record in reaching and exceeding strategic goals in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products.
- Technical or Sales Engineering experience in Computer Science or Information Systems.
- Technically minded, with an in-depth understanding of the technology and cloud computing market, and a passion for Google Cloud products (Workspace, Google Cloud Platform).
- Ability to build influential relationships and to deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
- Ability to effectively operate with enthusiasm and flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.

Sourced is a rapidly growing global consultancy with offices in multiple regions. Founded in 2010, we provide consulting services to migrate enterprise clients to hyperscale cloud providers. We specialize in organisation-wide cloud transformation and DevOps enablement for a wide range of industries, including financial services, healthcare, aviation, media, and telecommunications. Sourced has recently joined forces with Amdocs to accelerate innovation in the cloud. Sourced is a rapidly growing global consultancy with offices in multiple regions. Founded in 2010, we provide consulting services to migrate enterprise clients to hyperscale cloud providers. We specialize in organization-wide cloud transformation and DevOps enablement for a wide range of industries, including financial services, healthcare, aviation, media, and telecommunications. We work with some of the largest and most security-conscious organisations around the world to help them unlock innovation through cloud computing.
Sourced has recently joined forces with Amdocs to accelerate innovation in the cloud. Amdocs, a leading provider of software and professional services to more than 350 communication and media providers in over 80 countries, has more than 40 years of industry experience and welcomes Sourced to join its team of 26,000 employees.
What you'll be responsible for
Working closely with technical leads and client teams to fully demonstrate the benefits of cloud technology
Helping to build & introduce clients to automated delivery pipelines (CI/CD)
Defining and implementing cloud-based solutions in line with industry best practices and enterprise architecture guidelines
Supporting customers in troubleshooting issues in their test and/or production environments and identifying root cause
Presenting case studies and cloud solutions at meetups, conferences and technology events
Providing leadership, mentoring, and coaching to your teams
What you will bring to the role
Proven track record of enterprise IT consulting; experience in financial services is highly regarded
Proven experience architecting and implementing enterprise-scale, secure, and high availability solutions in the AWS Cloud environment
Experience in cloud deployment IaC templating using offerings such as CloudFormation and/or Terraform
A deep understanding of public cloud security principles and experience adhering to compliance standards
Thorough experience writing automation scripts with Python, Powershell, Ruby, NodeJS, Go or other
Experience working with source code management using Git
Deep experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes, and tools, such as Jenkins, CodePipeline, CodeDeploy, Atlassian Stack or other
Experience working with configuration management technologies such as Puppet, Chef, and/or Ansible
Knowledge of backup & recovery procedures and technologies, data storage and retention requirements
Experience with network design, subnetting, and routing
Experience in preparing and presenting technical material to a variety of audiences
Experience working in Agile project delivery teams
Desirable Skills
Experience working in heavily regulated industries, such as the financial services sector
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field
Database experience with SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL or other
Experience with more than one public cloud provider such as GCP and/or Azure
Knowledge of logging & event management tools such as Splunk, ELK or other
Professional and/or Specialty level AWS certifications
Experience in working with microservices or serverless architecture
Experience working with containers using Docker
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, individual career development plans, supportive management and team members, training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, annual company bonuses, and global relocation packages! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.
Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, Sourced Group are market leaders in providing program and project governance & delivery, modern technical consulting to businesses around the globe. Our goal is to thoroughly understand our clients business challenges and make technical recommendations to solve them. We have supplied specialist consultants as integral team leaders and members for digital transformations in leading brands in Australia, Canada and Singapore.
A rare opportunity is available for a positive, experienced, and passionate cloud delivery consultant with strong relationship management, communication, risk management and technical delivery skills. As a Sourced Solutions Enablement Consultant (Agile Delivery Consultant) you will be at the forefront of modern delivery techniques, worked on complex transformations predominantly in AWS, and have strong enterprise governance experience in delivery, security and risk management.
Leveraging your experience, you will be able to impact a number of large organisations with their adoption of established and emerging cloud technologies.
What you'll be responsible for:
Build strong relationships with client teams and develop a deep understanding of their business objectives and strategic drivers
Form strong project team relationships by leading, coaching, and motivating team members, and identifying and resolving blockers or conflicts
Lead and nurture best practice cloud delivery cultures in client teams that require guidance and assistance with turbo charging their cloud journeys
Proactively set and manage client and project team expectations and continually seek opportunities to increase satisfaction and strengthen relationships
Create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and project demands
Track and report on project outcomes and provide transparent communication channels to clients, project teams, and other project stakeholders
Proactively identify project issues and risks, and create action plans for resolving issues and mitigating risks
Manage security and operational risks inherent in cloud & digital transformation
You'll be comfortable and experienced in working with multiple project management concepts including PMBOK, and lean/agile/scrum
Work with the client success manager and director of business development on managing client account plans and developing opportunity pipeline
Ensure commercial changes are documented and approved through robust change control process
What you will bring to the role:
PMP and/or Agile certification and or combination of 5+ years of experience managing software delivery / cloud DevOps teams in an iterative delivery environment
You will be a high EQ individual that understands the value and importance of quality client and team relationships. This role will suit anyone who is satisfied by achieving client outcomes in an environment that is collaborative but professional, and that has a tight one company atmosphere
Prior experience in professional services working with enterprise customers in fast-paced, uncertain environments. Experience in financial services, airlines, utilities or media highly advantageous
Strong business acumen and comfort with business conversations including; writing business cases, assisting with accounts management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations
Strong facilitation skills with demonstrated experience leading scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases and managing geographically dispersed teams
Demonstrable exposure working with AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Understanding of cyber security, IT risk & control practices in cloud-based environments highly advantageous
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Track record of building successful relationships, internally and externally
Detail-oriented with a flair for problem-solving
Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills including creating usable documentation and tools
Ability to work at client sites
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, personalised career development plans, supportive management and team members, a training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, and global relocation packages! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.
Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know

OneConnect is a fast-growing financial technology company, focusing on providing cloud computing and other technology services to small- and medium-sized financial institutions. OneConnect has developed world-class technology innovations in areas, such as facial recognition, voiceprint, micro-expression recognition, and blockchain. With frequent team events, extensive mentoring and training, and collaboration opportunities you'll instantly become part of the well-respected sourced family. Providing a strong work/life balance is one of our core values and we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace with flexible working arrangements. The Singapore office is the regional office for a NYE-listed entity.

At least 4 to 5 years PQE either in private practice in a reputable law firm (disputes welcome) or as an in-house counsel in similar industry.

Strong initiative and motivation in working in a fast-paced, flexible, robust environment.
Possess business acumen grounded with a touch of practicality and pragmatism.
Prior exposure to various areas of law, regulations and polices including but not limited to the banking industry is a plus.
Analytical and logical with ability to work and make decisions under time pressure.
Ability to work in a team environment and possess leadership skills.

job_description:
Singtel are at the leading edge of technology development to improve the experience of our customers as they consume services across mobile, voice and data infrastructure, managed services, cloud computing, IT services and professional consulting. To support that journey, we are searching for top talent and have an exciting opportunity for a LeadArchitect to strengthen our team.
This is a strategic role expected to focus on Application Architecture for various digital channels and platforms.
Key Responsibilities
Understands business functions and transform requirements into architecture and blueprint for the solution being created. Need to propose new innovative solutions, updates to existing solutions, negotiate alternative options, build technical and release roadmaps
Construct a solution architecture around Microservices and APIs, and be able to decompose monolith applications into meaningful implementable Microservices and APIs in a Cloud/DevOps environment
Work closely with the development team and get their buy-in into accepting the design to be implemented. Also, work with different stake holders, product owner, senior executives, external parties like system integrators, product partners.
Provide technology perspective to business to achieve roadmap and prioritization by keeping abreast with industry trends. Where required, help business size the complexity of problem and help simplify and define MVP
The ideal candidate should possess:
Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or its equivalent
17+ years of experience in the technology industry including 8+ in architecture of scalable and high-performance internet facing systems
Possess strong background and experience as a successful Software engineer/Architect in building large scale, highly available Internet and mobile applications.
Have in depth knowledge of cloud computing, microservices architecture (incl. design pattern, rest/grpc, gateway & service mesh etc.), DevOps, Streaming architecture, Modern data architecture, Mobile and Web application architecture
Good experience in API security including OAuth2/OIDC, Tokens, mTLS etc.
Significant experience working on mission critical internet facing applications focusing on scalability, performance, architecture aspects
Passion for architecture and ability to pick up and learn new technological advances very quickly
Exhibits leadership in guiding team members, adapts to changes in technology and business domains, has good knowledge of latest trends in the market and is well respected within the team
Solid understanding of Public Cloud (pref. AWS) architecture. AWS certification is a big plus
Experience in Java, Spring boot, any modern messaging technology, any Traditional and NoSQL database is a big plus
We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

CRM experience preferred.

Strong computer skills, including CRM, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel.

job_description:
Company Description
Writing the future. Together.

Avaloq is a value driven, fast-paced financial technology and services company and we are committed to developing the banking solutions of tomorrow.

By joining Avaloq, you'll become a key part of our effort to power the digital transformation of the financial services industry. Our ambition is big and bold to provide full end-to-end digital solutions by combining our leading efficiency with a flexible, responsible digital user experience. Headquartered in Zurich, Avaloq has over 2,000 employees globally. More information is available at www.avaloq.com.
Interested Applicants, please visit https://www.avaloq.com/en/job-openings to apply directly.
Job Description
Your Team
Platform Operations Team holds the fort to the Infrastructure and the Platform services to support Avaloq's internal and external clients on a day-to-day basis. Being part of a dynamic team, the SMEs are involved in the inception, building and operating of the Infrastructure and Platform services, collaborating closely with Applications, Security Operations and Engineering teams.
As an individual contributor, he/she will be reporting to the Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) Team Lead. Also, he/she will work with the vendor team, network team, database specialist, backup and storage team, middleware team and deployment team.
This person is largely responsible for providing operational operating systems and services to the organization.
Your Mission
Installs / upgrades of Linux operating systems for in-house application
Installs application and database client software on servers, to interface with application server in a client/server setup
Configures and maintain clustering and failover for application / database servers to ensure scalability and availability
User administration on Linux systems including creates, modifies, and deletion of accounts, for user rights assignment and permission configurations, using LDAP in a multi-domain setup
Monitors and analyse system performance, detailing the system resource utilization versus user experiences and putting forth recommendations to improve users experience, ensuring high level of availability and usability.
Diagnoses and remediates operating systems and application issues
Scripting in Linux, to automate mundane daily routine tasks or repeatable installation tasks, with status reports on status of automated tasks, alerts on failed tasks and automated remedial actions for failed tasks.
Plans and implement backup and recovery strategy for the systems, performing system recovery tests on a periodic basis.
Implements system and user configurations and system hardening to comply with security policy
Performs impact analysis for hardware / operating system updates, patches and configuration changes
Writes and maintain technical system operating documents, detailing the systems functions, installation, configurations, backup and recovery procedures
Qualifications
What you need
Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent
Minimum 5 years of working experience in system administrator capacity
Certification in Linux
Experience in both virtualized and physical environments
Experience in supporting disaster recovery of Linux servers
Good knowledge of shell script programming and automation tasks.
Proficient in end-to-end troubleshooting involving network/security devices, operating systems, applications, databases, front-end etc.
Openshift and/or Cloud Computing experience (both private or public cloud)
Familiar with cloud infrastructure designs and implementations and the process from development to operations
Good oral and written communication skills with ability to present and discuss technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others and gains understanding
Process oriented with good documentation and diagrammatic skills
You will get extra points for the following
Availability is key for each Avaloq client that uses our services.
Skillsets to design and implement automation in order to put each new client into operations in the fastest time is beneficial.
Additional information
Now let's talk about perks and compensation
We offer high flexibility in regards to working models (e.g. part time and home office models are possible depending on business requirements). Our base salaries are competitive and if you prove to be a superstar, you might even be entitled to an extraordinary achievement reward. Avaloq aims to share its success with all its employees by paying out Success Share Units depending on its performance in a given year.
At Avaloq we embrace diversity, we embrace difference. We are whole-heartedly committed to equal employment opportunities and we foster an inclusive culture where everyone's contributions are valued and their voices are listened to. We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other fascinating characteristics that make us different. Please note that our job descriptions are intended to be written in an inclusive and gender neutral language.
Don't be shy apply!

Please only apply online https://smrtr.io/8gzJF, preferably with pdf documents.
Note to Agencies: All unsolicited rsums will be considered direct applicants and no referral fee will be acknowledged.

job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Business, Google Cloud - Singapore
Our team inspires leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like Google Workspace, Search, and Chrome. You reach out proactively to show customers how Google Cloud solutions can help them become more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients. Your guiding light is doing what's right for the customer, you will meet customers exactly where they are and provide them the best solutions for innovation. Using your passion for Google products, you help spread the magic of Google to organizations around the world.
Additional Role Description:
The Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales team focuses on business development in relation to small and medium-sized businesses. The sales team's priority is to maximize business growth through strategic promotion, advocacy, and cultivation of partners. The team also participates in research and experimentation with data-driven, scalable solutions intended to improve conversion rate and customer value.
As a Sales Representative, you will communicate with customers and discuss/advocate the value of Google Cloud solutions. You will provide ideas for how we can improve our product or enhance the customer experience.
In this role, you will manage new initiatives/experiments, while also managing stakeholders across many different functional teams in order to execute quickly and drive success. You will also work to develop business growth through campaigns, partner development, and marketing events.
Responsibilities:
- Manage opportunities and work with cross-functional teams. Act as the primary customer contact for adoption-related activities.
- Deliver against assigned strategic goals while prioritizing an excellent customer experience for our customers.
- Drive business development, forecast accurately, and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the business cycle.
- Partner with Sales Engineers and trusted Google Cloud Partners in order to maximize business results and cultivate opportunities with small/medium businesses.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience selling Software as a Service, Infrastructure as a Service, or Platform as a Service.
- Experience discussing Platform and Infrastructure as a service.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience in reaching and exceeding strategic goals in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products.
- Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce).
- Experience in Technical or Sales Engineering within Computer Science or Information Systems.
- Knowledge and understanding of the technology and cloud computing market.
- Ability to speak and write in Korean fluently to present clients/agencies with new products, campaign results, and performance
- Ability to build influential relationships and deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.

We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.
Why join us
Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.
But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.

Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...)

Hunt for new business within existing customer accounts

At least 3-5 years of experience in a full cycle, closing role, in the technology/software industry
Experience in closing deals in Asia (excluding Japan)
Based in Singapore
Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding quota
Experience utilizing sales methodologies such as MEDDPICC, Challenger, Sandler, etc.

job_description:
Job summary

Are you passionate about operational excellence, including cost optimisation Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale challenges in the world today Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners that use cloud computing services to run their solutions reliably, securely, efficiently and at lower cost
At AWS Enterprise Support we are looking for a Senior Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM) to provide unique deep-dive technical engagements for our Enterprise customers across Asia-Pacific, Japan and China (APJC). Based in Singapore (part of the ASEAN team), you will be a member of a dynamic team bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies, focussed on the difficult cost and agility challenges facing many organisations.
You will provide strategic people, process and technology guidance to proactively improve performance, reliability, security and cost-effectiveness of customers solutions using AWS best practices. This role will focus on providing customers with AWS Cloud Operations best practices for Cost Optimisation, Monitoring and Observability, People and Process, Incident Management, Disaster Recover, Continuous Improvement and other DevSecOps topics.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic qualifications
Minimum 6+ years of technical engineering experience
Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience as a technical lead
Preferred qualifications
Software development experience in automation, infrastructure-as-code, tools and dashboards. Experience in a high-level programing language such as Python, Golang or Java
Internal enterprise experience working with a wide range of internal stakeholders on operations implementation or migration with a company-wide impact.
Ability to understand complex cloud environments and bridge the gap between technical and business requirements
Track record of implementing cloud best practices (provisioning, deployment, monitoring using AGILE / Devops methodologies and tools) for enterprise companies or large internet scale start-ups
Understanding of cloud operations, hybrid cloud environments and cloud migration projects at scale, particularly from an operational effectiveness and reliability perspective
10+ years of technical engineering experience
Experience in operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (4) or more of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / Databases / DevOps / Security / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment
Professional oral and written communication skills, presenting to an audience containing one or more decision maker(s)
Experience with AWS services and/or other cloud offerings

job_description:
Job summary
Would you like to help the largest Private Equity (PE) firms and their portfolio companies leverage new technologies to improve their operations Would you like to use your IT leadership experience to build relationships with technical leaders, C-level executives, and influencers at all levels across the PE segment

As a Private Equity Solutions Architect, you will work directly with Private Equity firms, their portfolio companies, and consulting partners to help them adopt new technologies and build new solutions to make the most of the Cloud. You will be at the crossroads of business and technology, engaging with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. You will provide thought leadership in terms of looking beyond the technology and considering the value that technology creates for our customers. You will practice your creativity by linking technology to tangible solutions and business outcomes. You will educate PE firms and their portfolio companies about the art of the possible, defining and developing cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. You will have the opportunity to present publicly at AWS conferences and industry events.

The ideal candidate will possess a technical background that enables them to drive customer engagement with business, finance or IT executives at the highest levels of our PE customers. You will have experience working with complex IT environments including applications, middleware, storage, networks, information security, and operations. You will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of businesses

The Private Equity Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a balanced technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will develop deep expertise in AWS technologies, as well as a broad set of tools and methodologies of how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform.

At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of your customers. We value your passion to discover, invent, and build on behalf of customers. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones so you can make impactful contributions to architecture discussions with customers.

Amazon has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.

Key job responsibilities
As a Private Equity Solutions Architect, you will work directly with Private Equity Firms and/or executives of their portfolio companies to design technology solutions to solve specific business challenges or accelerate business initiatives.
Scoping and understand specific use cases to design appropriate AWS-based technical solutions (including, integrations with third party solutions).
Own the technical relationship with PE firms and the C-suite of portfolio companies and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
Serve as a key technical member of the AWS PE team to help ensure customer success in architecting, building, migrating, or optimizing applications and services on the AWS platform.
Build rapport with Executives at both PE firms and their portcos leveraging your understanding of enterprise architecture, merger and acquisitions, migration and cost optimisation of IT infrastructure and other key technologies
Establish technical credibility with PE firms and their portcos to lead discussions with CTOs, CIOs, Chief Architects, Senior Developers, etc. from both customer and partners across the PE segment.
Provide technical and architectural guidance to PE firms and their portcs and help develop cost optimisation strategies by deploying the right architecture given their budget constraints.
Evangelise and educate key stakeholders with the Private Equity ecosystem about AWS technologies.
Influence AWS's roadmap of new features and services based on customer feedback.
Create and capture best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organisation by hiring, coaching and mentoring others.
Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, related field OR equivalent technical work experience.
Experience working directly with customers (internal or external) in either technical pre-sales, post-sales, consulting, or customer support function.
7-10 years of experience as a technical leader architecting, building, consulting, and/or operating large scale distributed applications and infrastructure.
Willingness to travel to customer locations as needed
Passion for technology and for learning
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working in a customer-facing role interacting with senior levels stakeholders include C-suite.
Experience collaborating effectively with internal or external stakeholder groups (Customers, System Integrators, ISVs, etc.) at multiple levels.
Experience working in (or with) Private Equity firms, Hedge Funds, or Investment Banking specifically defining technology strategy or IT implementations/integrations related to Mergers and Acquisitions.
Working knowledge of cloud native architectures and experience architecting, developing, deploying, and/or operating IT applications or infrastructure on AWS services (or other related cloud computing technologies).
Broad technical knowledge of enterprise IT including: overall enterprise architecture, application development, database systems, server and desktop virtualisation, storage, data centre operations, networking, security, integrating enterprise applications etc.
Working knowledge in a technology domain, distributed web or mobile applications, DevOps, serverless, big data, analytics, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
Experience introducing cloud or new technologies to meet or exceed business requirements.
Experience presenting in one to many public forums.
AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional).
Continued or advanced learning (Master, MBA, PhD or equivalent) in Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics or related technical field.

job_description:
This role will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is rapidly expanding its presence in the enterprise arena with a focus on financial services. AWS offers global public cloud offerings with a diversity of compliance programs and attestations to enable AWS customer base. AWS is looking for independent, passionate, and deeply experienced professionals in the global financial services compliance and governance arena to provide thought leadership in assisting financial institutions to move regulated workloads and data into the cloud by addressing their specific security, regulatory, compliance and governance requirements. This candidate should be an experienced and innovative security/compliance/governance professional who has the ability to handle a wide range of compliance requirements and can translate those requirements into applications for cloud computing. The Compliance Specialist will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

This key position requires specialized experience supporting financial services sector compliance efforts and will have high visibility at the most senior levels of government agencies, institutions, and AWS including frequent interaction with CISOs, CTOs, CCOs, CROs, their staffs, and AWS senior leadership. The position, as part of the AWS Worldwide Financial Services team, will act as the primary Governance/Compliance interface for Financial Services institutions. The candidate will already have, and continue to foster, key relationships, and be able to interpret the impacts of policy changes, and track and report on industry trends.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participate in financial services regulatory compliance assessments and relevant control discussions with AWS teams. This includes synthesizing control requirements, and recommending and pursuing alternative approaches assisting customers in developing compliance roadmaps
Develop industry leading compliance related, customer-facing resources based on projected customer needs and current demand
Assist the AWS Security Assurance team in determining the strategic direction of the various AWS compliance programs based on customer interaction and demonstrative metrics
Be and remain connected with industry trends and events. Develop and maintain relationships with key leaders in governance, risk, and compliance at Financial Services institutions
Collaborate with service teams on industry specific requirements that impact components of AWS services
Assist the work of Financial Services institutions internal and external auditors or advisors as needed
Keep the AWS Worldwide Financial Services leadership team fully informed of customer engagement status, issues, and activities.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or other related business fields
Progressive experience in Financial Services compliance, legal, or governance
Personal, hands-on experience in developing compliance/regulatory documentation
Experience in working directly with senior corporate/government officials and/or auditors
Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must
Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Travel may be required for this role, up to 50%.





PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Familiarity with technical assessments and audit methodologies for technical systems (network, operating systems, application security) as well as IT auditing processes
Familiarity with cloud computing services/deployment architecture
Demonstration of innovative compliance approaches in non-traditional IT environments (cloud)
Experience and proficiency in public speaking
Deep understanding of relevant regulatory guidance Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP), National Institute for Science and Technology (NIST) guidelines, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), FCA guidance FG16/5 (Guidance for firms outsourcing to the cloud and other third party IT services), EBA Recommendations on Outsourcing to Cloud Providers, C5 requirements of the Federal Office of Information Security of Germany and other applicable standards and requirements
Experience in building successful compliance programs
Experience defining compliance roadmaps based on customer requirements, compliance documentation, and ensuring that committed assessments are delivered on schedule
Have a record of delivery of onboarding compliance financial services workloads
Intermediate or better level of knowledge of certification requirements of an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) under the aforementioned compliance programs
Ability to think critically and be responsive to time sensitive requests

Azure is the fastest-growing business in Microsoft's history and is the foundation of Microsoft's commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade Cloud that has a true hybrid story. Customers and analysts recognize Azure's tremendous momentum which continues month over month. To help customers achieve their goals, Azure continues to build the largest global footprint of any Cloud provider.
As we drive to be the leading cloud platform in the world, Azure Global is hiring an exceptional Program Manager Lead to help drive our hyper-scale business forward in SEA. Azure will be the best cloud for every customer in this hyper growth market as our landscape evolves, come make that happen with us.
When strategic customers in Emerging Markets such as SEA choose Azure as their cloud of choice, they have unique needs the way they view the economics of partnerships; their risk assessment and execution plan; their high bar for security, privacy and data residency; their specialized compute and storage requirements all contribute to the need for specialization, requiring a tailored approach. This role touches all these facets and requires a seasoned Program Manager that can lead a team, and embody a CEO mindset, scoped to a growing SEA business with a select set of customers within Azure.
Responsibilities
Build and deliver the strategic plan for engineering engagement in SEA in partnership with the regional subsidiary leadership.
Engage with key customers at the CxO level, driving co-innovation partnerships in critical industries
Effectively lead a team of Program Managers to positively impact the regional business while insuring the team is the bridge between SEA businesses with Engineering teams
Experience in executive communication and ability to communicate with senior internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to identify patterns that can be replicated to create scale.
Qualifications
Required qualifications:
BS or higher degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent industry experience
12+ years of experience in ICT related industry
3+ years of experience in Cloud Computing specifically in Azure will be a plus
5+ years of experience in technical Business Development or Sales working with strategic customers in Southeast Asia
5+ years of experience in people management
Preferred Qualifications:
Deep experience working with strategic customers in Southeast Asia
Demonstrates strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills
Experience in being able to collaborate with multiple stakeholders
Ability to analyze and operate at various levels of abstraction
Ability to balance what is strategically right with what is practically realistic
Ability to innovate and drive change
Passion and focus on delivering the right customer experience
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Who We Are
We love changing the way the world works! We are an exciting technology innovation company that provides cutting-edge and transformative urban solutions for the facilities services industry. Our robotics and software platform turns boring data into context-rich and meaningful information to help businesses digitize and automate their current processes in an increasingly digitalized world. We pride ourselves in our values of Innovation, Excellence, Integrity and most importantly our People.
We're looking for an experienced DevOps engineer to join our team. As the ideal candidate, you're a leader and a doer - someone who can function as a big picture thinker, as well as roll up your sleeves to execute. You take a creative approach to challenges and initiatives and never settle for good enough. You're thoughtful and team-oriented with a strong bias to action and you care about doing what's best for our customers, and our team.
Key priorities and responsibilities
Oversee the day-to-day activities among the R&D and software department, fully responsible for the service availability and reliability

job_description:
Job Description:
Get to know our Team:
Internal Audit is an independent function within Grab that provides an objective assurance and advisory role to Grab's senior management.
We use a systematic, disciplined risk-based approach to evaluate and assess Grab's risks, processes and internal controls.
Reflecting Grab's entrepreneurial spirit, Internal Audit covers multiple businesses and technology areas.
Get to know the Role:
As a Manager of Technology Audit, you are responsible to effectively manage audits and risk advisory activities that cover the associated risks arising from use of Technology activities across Grab's businesses.
You report directly to the Head of Technology Audit & Innovation, and work in a team of technology auditors who are specialised in the audits of Technology and related activities within the Grab's businesses.
We seek a candidate who brings excellent audit and risk advisory experience to complement the Technology Audit team, in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
You effectively plan, manage and execute audits, including the design of audit work steps to evaluate the risks associated with governance, financial, operational, regulatory, and business continuity.
The day-to-day activities:
Support the Head of Technology Audit & Innovation as part of the Technology Audit team.
Work with the Technology Audit team and partner the other IA teams, focusing on all risks arising from the Technology activities across Grab's businesses.
Plan and perform risk-based assessments, understand and evaluate the business environment, related technology controls and processes.
Prepare draft/ final report and participate in the presentation of audit findings.
Develop and maintain business relations with Grab's management, and be the trusted risk advisor on control related matters.
The must haves:
Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science/engineering, accountancy, finance or equivalent, with professional certification (e.g., CISA, CISM, CISSP).
Specialised experience in auditing applications supporting businesses processes and products
Experienced in auditing cybersecurity domains and/or cloud computing environment will be an added advantage.
10-12 years of technology audit and risk advisory (including Sarbanes-Oxley) experience.
Strong knowledge of technology regulatory requirements and expectations within South-East Asia.
Excellent command of English.
Proficiency in productivity tools (email, calendar, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Located in Singapore, and ability to travel for work when required.
Experience and knowledge in the following:
Excellent technology auditing skills, with strong confidence for interaction with stakeholders.
Experience with the use of data analytics and visualisation tools for audit will be an added advantage.

As a thought leader, evangelizing and helping customers and partners understand the technical and business benefits of Alibaba Cloud products, solutions and services.
Understanding the unique requirements of customers and partners, and providing appropriate technical solutions and architecture designs based on Alibaba Cloud technologies, solutions and services.
Creating and presenting solution architecture designs to C-level/Senior personnel.

Providing assistance to customers and partners to migrate their existing IT systems onto Alibaba Cloud
Providing guidance in large enterprise implementation.
Job Requirements:
Solid foundation in computer science and cloud computing, with a good understanding of network, compute, storage systems
Solid experience with modern web stacks, big data or AI applications
A minimum of 8+ years in solution architecture design or consulting with hands on large-scale implementation experiences
Expert knowledge and understanding of solution architecture design, and familiar with architectural methodologies and practices in Internet based applications
Familiarity with procedures and tools for application migration and cloud/virtualization solutions for Enterprise customers
Ability to learn quickly and have a passion for cloud technology
Ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges
Possess a passion for innovation, and helping customers and partners to achieve success
Industry and domain expertise in some key areas such as: Supply Chain Management, Manufactory, automotive and E-Commerce are essential; Genomic/Healthcare, Media, Travel, Education, CDN is a plus
Experience in traditional enterprise IT and LOB system is a plus;EA and SA certification are a plus;Security, Big data, ML, AI experience is a plus

job_description:
Job Description:
Get to know our Team:
The Systems & Operations Engineering team is responsible for getting things to production in the most efficient and fastest way possible. We architect solutions, tools and platforms around provisioning, configuration, CICD, monitoring, SLA, performance and uptime. Our team is passionate about the details and we work very closely with a wide range of stakeholders.
Get to know the Role:
- Design and implement the architecture of next generation of automated infrastructure following Infrastructure as a Code model.
- Identify and resolve problems relating to critical service operations and to prevent their recurrence using different methods of automation
- Be involved in change, release and incident management
- Help improve reliability, stability and tackle scalability challenges with engineering teams
- Mentor other engineers, define our technical culture, and help build a fast-growing team
The day-to-day activities:
- Devise & implement solutions which will stop problems which are yet to happen (prevention is better than cure!)
- Everything as a code - if anything was done manually - find out the reason and fix it to ensure its never ever done manually again.
- Identify and resolve problems relating to critical service operations and to prevent their recurrence using different methods of automation
- Be involved in the design and subsequent implementation of software and service infrastructure
- Mentor other engineers, define our technical culture, and help build a fast-growing team
The must haves:
- Preferably a degree in computer science, software engineering, information technology or related fields
- 3 years of relevant experience with managing IT infrastructure with focus on the *nix platforms
- Possess a solid understanding of the Linux or FreeBSD/OpenBSD family of Operating Systems and their underlying components
- Possess analytical skills, mental resiliency and the ability to think systematically under stressful conditions
- Highly accountable and takes ownership. Outstanding work ethic, high-integrity, team player, and a lifelong learner
- Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Go, or scripting experience in Shell
- Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate and work effectively across the organization.
Nice to Have:
- Experience with cloud computing technologies from vendors such as Amazon Web Services, Google Compute Engine, Digital Ocean
- Configuration management tool experience such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet or SaltStack
- Experience with continuous integration and/or continuous deployment
- Experience with hardening systems and knowledge in information security
- Contributes to open source projectExperience with performance analysis and debugging tools

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government. Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Customer Engineer, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud (Korean) - Singapore
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
Additional Role Description:
As a Customer Engineer, you'll help shape and execute technical business strategies, acting as a trusted advisor to our clients and helping them to realize maximum business value from Google Cloud. You'll assist the Sales team by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers, while also liaising with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay up-to-date on industry trends and to devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

job_title: Technical Solutions Specialist, Hybrid Cloud, Google Cloud - Singapore
tech_stack: Kubernetes  Cloud Computing  Vblock  Google Cloud Platform  Web Technologies  Logging  Networking  System Administration  Debugging  Virtualization  security clearance  Troubleshooting  Web Developers  Articulate  Disposition  Brand Awareness
job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Technical Solutions Specialist, Hybrid Cloud, Google Cloud - Singapore
The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Google Cloud business and in bringing our product portfolio into companies around the world.
Additional Role Description:
The Hybrid Cloud services team is building a new offering for Google Cloud customers that require more than just break/fix support. We assist with the entire hardware/software lifecycle, including planning, deployment, maintenance, upgrading, monitoring, and capacity planning. Our services are especially crucial for hybrid customer engagements where Google Cloud is delivering and maintaining infrastructure inside the customer's on-premises environment. These deployments can incorporate requirements such as disconnected mode, security clearance, sovereign and geographical constraints.
This is a customer facing role; you must enjoy working directly with customers.
You will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and when needed, coding/scripting. You will help drive the success of Google Cloud by understanding and advocating for our customers issues. This will include a need to sometimes work non-standard work hours or shifts. This will include a rotation on weekend work.
Responsibilities:
- Manage the customer's problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of new investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on Google Cloud Platform products.
- Develop an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis.
- Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in engineering, sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.
- Work as part of a team of engineers/consultants that globally ensure 24 hour customer support. This will include a need to sometimes work non-standard work hours or shifts.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience configuring and troubleshooting Kubernetes infrastructure
- Experience with networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, Routing, VPNs, VLANs, Peering, Load Balancing, etc.)
- Experience with web technologies (HTTP, HTML, DNS, etc.)
Preferred qualifications:
- Have Government G50 Security Clearance with industry experience working in Government, dealing with sensitive/classified workloads.
- Experience working directly in a customer facing role
- Experience with any of the following IaaS solutions: system virtualization, on-premise and/or hybrid cloud computing, cloud identity and security system, cloud monitoring and logging and/or local and cloud storage.
- Excellent attention to detail, troubleshooting, and written and verbal communication skills.
