job_title: Senior Assistant Director (Information Technology Audit Department)
tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Information Technology  Operating Systems  Databases  organ  Leadership  auditing standards  Interpersonal Skills  It Governance  Risk Management  audit management  It Audit  Audits  Accountability  Cisa  Sourcing  Audit
job_description:
Job Title: Senior Assistant Director (Information Technology Audit Department)
Job Type: 2-years Contract, possibility of conversion
Job Location: Central Singapore
Key Skills: Experience in IT Systems Audit
Our Client:
It is an independent organ of state and the national auditor & playing an important role in enhancing public accountability in the management and use of public funds and resources through audits. We are sourcing for a Senior Assistant Director (2-year contract emplaceable onto permanent establishment) to join its IT Audit Department.
Job Purpose:
You will be part of the Information Technology (IT) Audit Department responsible for carrying out IT audits to support the audit of the Government Financial Statements (GFS), other Financial Statements audits, and selective audits of public sector entities. These IT audits are to ascertain the adequacy and effectiveness of controls in Government ICT systems and processes.
Responsibilities:
Develop a good understanding of the Government ICT environment, key developments and growing trends relevant to IT audits (e.g. control requirements in the Government Instruction Manual on IT Management, use of cloud computing, greater automation of processes, block chain technology etc.)
To plan and lead/execute IT audits on ICT systems and processes of the Government and public sector entities. This includes identifying control weaknesses, areas of concern, obtaining the necessary audit evidence to support the audit observations and preparing the necessary working papers and reports. As part of evidence gathering to support the audit conclusions, you will also be required to interview auditees, analyse system configurations and perform system logs analysis.
Prepare/review draft audit reports to ensure that they clearly communicate audit observations, audit concerns and recommendations to address any lapses.
Provide technical advice/assistance to financial auditors.
Supervise and coach junior team members for selected projects.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by supervisor.
Job Requirements
Singapore Citizen
Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems studies or equivalent
At least 8 years of experience in IT systems audit, of which at least 5 years experience is in leading and overseeing audit team(s)
Possess good knowledge in the principles of IT governance, risks and controls
Possess a good understanding of Operating Systems, Databases, Networks or Enterprise Applications. A good understanding of the IT environment/key systems of Government and public entities would be an advantage
Possess strong leadership, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills
Possess CISA certification or equivalent certifications
If interested, please share your updated CV in word format at [HIDDEN TEXT] stating your current / expected salary & availability to take it forward. The offered salary will commensurate with qualification and years of experience.
Manisha Sharma
RMA Consultants Pte Ltd
EA License No. 93C4403
EA Regn. No. R1872602

job_description:
Meet Our Team:
Be part of a rapidly growing and dynamic client success organization and help shape the future of our company. As a Senior Portfolio Success Manager, you will be a key point of contact and trusted advisor for our clients in helping them to realize their dream of digital transformation.
Picture Yourself at Pega:
A Senior Portfolio Success Manager is responsible for maintaining and expanding relationships and provide technical expertise, where applicable, within a set of defined accounts that are of critical importance to Pega based on reference engagement, and ongoing revenue stream. These accounts will also require a high level of vertical expertise as well as ongoing program adoption management and leadership.
What You'll Do at Pega:
Develop a trusted advisor relationship with multiple people in the account to expand engagement with stakeholders across the client organization
Serve as the account's advocate within Pega, managing escalations quickly and effectively and coordinating with other organizations at Pega to take action on behalf of the client
Use discrete and aggregate measures of client health to drive insights, to identify and mitigate areas of risk, and to take proactive action
Engage as a Pega thought leader during the execution of strategic programs to encourage the client and partner to embrace the Pega delivery best practices
Leverage proven techniques to assess the value clients have achieved through the use of Pega technology and then turn those insights in to recommendations to enhance value realization
Leverage industry and product knowledge to share insights about how client can maximize license to drive business benefits.
Who You Are:
As a client satisfaction and revenue driver, the Senior Portfolio Success Manager leverages data and relationships to help Pega clients achieve their business objectives after the initial sale and continuing through the client lifecycle.
Comfortably engages with front-line teams and C-suite leaders, employing the Challenger model to drive business insights. They understand Pega best practices and how to adapt them within each client's environment to achieve faster time to value.
Has an analytics orientation. Client Success requires analysis of available data to determine client health and identification of new data - to drive proactive outreach, which in turn increases client satisfaction and lowers sales and delivery risks.
Drives for results. Contribute to account plans, and organize resources required to execute the plans and achieve desired outcomes. They measure progress against KPIs, successfully balancing the client's needs and value to Pega.
Is a thought leader. They leverage their deep domain experience, product knowledge, and industry trends to home in on quantifiable benefits and focus intently on realizing them.
Is service-oriented. They are the primary post-sale point of contact for the client. They address root causes of dissatisfaction, and proactively coordinate with specialists in Pega to smooth the client journey and help ensure that Pega's applications are best in class.
What You've Accomplished:
BA/BS Degree or equivalent business experience
10+ experience with at least 5+ years experience in Consulting or consultative sales strongly preferred
Technical aptitude, either gained from a formal computer science education, or alternative practical experience
Proficiency-level understanding of systems development lifecycle, including agile methods
Executive-level communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively navigate and mediate conflict and foster honest dialogue
Consulting skills and proven results working as a trusted advisor to drive business value for clients or stakeholders
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure
Strong knowledge of software business processes (Sales, Marketing, Service, Support), business applications and automation
Additional Preferred Qualifications (based on account portfolio):
Strongly prefer existing knowledge of Pega product and platform features, capabilities, and best use
Experience implementing Customer Relationship Management solutions (CRM) or other complex IT projects within large enterprises
Skilled at Program Management within large organizations, helping to effectively drive change across groups by engaging key stakeholders
Proven effectiveness at leading and facilitating executive meetings and workshops
Experience with account portfolio planning and prioritization
Familiarity with Cloud Computing technologies, concepts and benefits
Pega Offers You:
Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products
Continuous learning and development opportunities
An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company
A career in the rapidly growing profession of Customer/Client Success in the Software as a service industry.

job_description:
GovTech Singapore has awarded InfoCepts the provision of Data Science software and services for Government Ministries/Departments, statutory boards, organs of the state and participating entities.
About InfoCepts
InfoCepts is a global leader of end-to-end data & analytics solutions with nearly 20 years of experience, also named as Gartner's 2020 and 2021 customers choice for Data & Analytics providers. We continue to grow rapidly year over year, now employing more than 1,000 people in offices across the globe. As we have grown, we have stayed true to our missionto always help our customers stay modern that help them make smart, data-driven decisions. Since 2004, we have deployed hundreds of high performance analytics applications over web and mobile platforms, built several advanced analytics models, processed petabytes of data using Big Data technologies and delivered several high impact business solutions. Driven by our vision of delivering great customer experiences, we are looking for professionals who are passionate about making the world a better place by leveraging the power of data.
Presently we are expanding our Singapore business unit and thus seeking out aspiring / proven Project Managers to join our cause in helping clients Stay Modern, ahead of the technology curve!
Roles and Responsibilities:
Function as the principal consultant and expert for assigned projects for end-to-end solutioning
Work with project team and partners to ensure best-in-class experience and deliver high quality business intelligence solutions to clients
Engage senior stakeholders, manage project timelines, expectations and risks
Partner with management on project and resource planning
Continuously identify opportunities to optimize experience throughout the client journey to create positive impact
Stay abreast with new technologies, industry best practices, standards and trends, leveraging on the cutting edge to value-add to our people and clients
Skills Required:
Degree in Information Technology, Software Engineering, Data Analytics and/or related fields
Proven work experience in leading project teams (regardless of size) in client solutioning and delivery
Strong technical knowledge to BI, Big Data, data warehousing and visualization tools is essential; familiarity with Artificial Intelligence tools is a plus
Savvy with development & Integration which will include setting up configuration management, developing components, peer review, creating unit test plans & performing unit testing
Good communication and interpersonal skills, as well as command of English
Problem-solving skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations
Team-working skills
Verbal and Written communication skills
Proven working experience in data analysis

Job Description
We are looking for solution architect to join the Application Services (Customer Service) department in SIA Information Technology Division. You will play an important role in evaluating the business requirements or challenges, collaborate with business and IT teams to come out with optimal solutions in the form of products or services that adhere to the enterprise standards.
Key Responsibilities:
Guide project teams to ensure the consistency of the configuration, design and development.
Analyse, design and communicate end-to-end solutions that are customer value driven, that meet the approved architecture and security standards, and are in-line with the strategic direction of the applications.
Ensure that applications platform's performance meets or exceeds operational metrics for scalability, security, compliance, performance and quality in accordance with service level agreements.
Lead applications platform maturity by applying industry best practices and technical due diligence.
Develop an in-depth knowledge of all aspects of the solution domain to implement the most current and relevant solutions.
Assist the Enterprise Architect in establishing the architecture standards for the whole organisation and contributing to the technology roadmap.
Stay abreast of the technology landscape, and identify or strengthen capabilities that can be leveraged for business impact.
Any ad-hoc duties as required.
This is an individual contributor role.
Requirements
IT degree with at least 4 years of work experience in MNCs as a solution architect.
Proven track record in designing complex, hybrid clouds (On-premise, AWS, Azure, GCP) applications that meet or exceed operational metrics for scalability, security, compliance, performance and quality.
Deep knowledge of software architecture and design.
Well-versed in frontend and backend technology stack for web and mobile applications.
Good grasp of enterprise integration patterns and the ability to apply the patterns in the solution.
Outcome driven.
Ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of business units, developers, DevOps, Cyber Security, ITSM and other subject matter experts.
Strong conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication, negotiation and influencing skills.

job_description:
Key Responsibilities
Is proficient on primary toolset and demonstrates ability to acquire additional systems and applications. Performs startup activities through Tier II with limited support. Able to complete qualifications with minimal assistance.
Completes quality repairs. Actively responds to fab issues by communicating with engineers in other locations and participating in escalation conference calls. job_description:
The Manager, Software Development is a technical and people manager role that reports to the Chief Technology Officer. In this role, you are responsible for the success of delivering an application working on a platform that delivers Operations centric functions for the business that is independent to the M&E technology deployed in the data centre. You will lead the team of software developers in the development and implementation of these Operations applications and/or platforms. As a People Manager, you will provide technical mentorship and team building leadership to your team members while ensuring timely delivery of these applications to the business.
Roles and Responsibilities
Team Management
Manages all the activities of the software development team
Be involved in the recruitment of talent
Develop training plans to train new developers
Lead and mentor team members to encourage work productivity;
Lead the team of developers to deliver the software platform based on product roadmap and schedules
Sets attainable goals to team members in order for the project to be completed on time
Software Development
Responsible for overall software development life cycle of solution
Analyse software requirements, implement design plans and review unit tests
Responsible for writing and reviewing product requirements and specifications
Ensure that timeline is adhered to deliver projects timely
Ensure appropriate procedures and processes are adhered to for software development
Participate in software design and design control activities;
Participate in other areas of the software development process;
Operational Excellence To monitor and operate production services
Project Management
Ensure proper documentation of software development;
Participate in project meetings;
Monitor, evaluate and ensure the completion of tasks and projects;
Others
Design and implement a proper software development environment for the team
Represent the software department in project meetings
Provide technical support to other company personnel
Requirements:
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related discipline
7 years of relevant experience in software development
5 years of experience in a supervisory role to lead and mentor a team of developers
Extensive technical background and hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
Proficient in the following technology: REST APIs, XML and JSON, responsive UI with JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, HTML and CSS, Cloud Computing
Ability to manage multiple projects
Experience in the data centre industry is an added advantage

tech_stack: Kubernetes  Cloud Computing  Automation Tools  Open Source  Networking  Python  Ansible  Virtualization  Linux  Architecture Design  Consulting
job_description:
The position:
This exciting role in Ashnik's consulting team brings great opportunity to deploy automation solutions for Ashnik's enterprise customers spread across SEA and India. You will work hands-on with our team focusing on infrastructure solutions and to automate infrastructure deployments that are secure and compliant.
Responsibilities:
To be part of the consultative discussions to identify challenges for the customers and suggest right fit open-source tools
Assist in design and develop moderately complex software solutions to meet needs
Help create consulting work packages, detailed SOWs and assist sales team to position them to enterprise customers
Implement the automation recipes (Ansible/CHEF) and scripts (Ruby, PowerShell, Python) as part of an automated installation/deployment process
Create and share the POC's
Participate in webinars, videos, and internal trainings
Qualification and Experience required:
Overall 4-5 Years experience in IT with 3+ years experience working as Pre-Sales/ Technical Sales / Technical Solution Architect role.
Graduate from Engineering or equivalent.
Experience working in IT infrastructure background specially with Open-source Software.
Working experience on Container and Kubernetes will be added advantage.
Strong understanding and knowledge of networking architecture
Hands on experience in delivery projects required
Skills Required:
Certification in AWS/Azure/GCP will added advantages.
Certification in automation tools such as Ansible, Terraform is an added advantage.
Experience working in the BFSI domain is an advantage
What is in it for You
You would be adding a great experience of working with a leading open-source solutions company in the Southeast Asia region to your career. You would get to learn from the leaders and grow in the industry. This would be a great opportunity for you to grow in your career through continuous learning, adding depth and breadth to technologies. Since we work with leading open-source technologies, Cloud and Kubernetes platforms, and engage with large enterprises, it creates enormous possibilities for career growth for our team. Not to mention that our people find the journey with Ashnik to be exciting and a fulfilling experience.
About Us
Ashnik is a leading enterprise open-source solutions company in Southeast Asia and India, enabling organizations to adopt open source for their digital transformation goals. Founded in 2009, it offers a full-fledged Open-Source Marketplace, Solutions, and Services Consulting, Managed, Technical, Training. Over 200 leading enterprises so far have leveraged Ashnik's offerings in the space of Database platforms, DevOps & Microservices, Kubernetes, Cloud, and Analytics.
As a team culture, Ashnik is a family for its team members. Each member brings in a different perspective, new ideas and diverse background. Yet we all together strive for one goal to deliver the best solutions to our customers using open-source software. We passionately believe in the power of collaboration. Through an open platform of idea exchange, we create a vibrant environment for growth and excellence.

job_description:
Interested in taking your career to the next level driving the market success of a strategic priority for Oracle in Cloud
Why this role
Dedicated Region Cloud@Customer is Oracle's strategic offering for a managed private cloud/distributed cloud i.e. OCI commercial region dedicated to a single customer deployed in their datacentre. To drive market success of this offering, we are investing in building a team of highly talented individuals in Asia Pacific.
What You'll Do
You will own & drive OCI-Dedicated Region opportunities from inception to close, working closely with the in-region Geo Managing Directors, Cloud Sales Leaders and Key Account Leaders.
Manage all aspects of opportunity lifecycle and orchestrate the alignment of key resources at the relevant stages of the lifecycle.
Support identification to qualification of opportunities. For qualified opportunities, lead the business case development (TCO models, workload identification- existing & new), solution architecture, commercial constructs- Overall proposition development and articulation.
You will pitch the overall proposition at not only the customer CXO level (CEO, COO etc) but also at technical level (Architect teams, Infrastructure teams etc).
Pull all stops from the sale.
Who You'll Work With
Primarily with our customers but working with extended teams internally is very vital for this role. You will work extensively with Insight, TCE, Industry Architects, Cloud Pursuit & OCI Product management teams.
Who You Are
If you enjoy taking on challenges in Technical-Business Development & exploring unchartered territories, this role is for you.
To be successful in this role, you will need a strong background in Datacentre transformation/Hyperconverged Infrastructure/Private Cloud/Large cloud migrations in a presales or an implementer role. Strong understanding of OCI (Oracle Cloud Infrastructure) or other cloud hyperscaler is a must. Experience in Distributed Cloud (AWS Outpost, Azure Stack, GCP Anthos, Nutanix, Openshift) is preferred.
You have over 15 years of rich experience having worked on multiple technologies, managed/implemented large deals or pursuits & become a trusted advisor to customers.
You have witnessed the data centre evolution from converged infrastructure to hyper converged infrastructure to software defined datacentre. This experience will help pitch the value of OCI platform & software defined infrastructure when deployed in the customers datacenter.
You have experience migrating workloads to public clouds This will help engage with customers and identify suitable workloads in the datacentre to migrate to OCI- Dedicated region.
You have experience managing large deals & pitching to C-Level This will help you lead & manage the OCI-Dedicated Region opportunity through the lifecycle that can span 2-4 quarters. Your experience pitching to C-Level will come handy articulating the overall OCI-Dedicated region proposition.
You have experience in Digital transformation initiatives This will help you convince customers to leverage OCI- Dedicated region as a platform for innovation. This experience is desirable and not mandatory, you would know this terminology having managed responses to multiple RFI/RFPs.
You exude a strong technical aptitude, high motivation to develop new business & a positive attitude that is contagious. You are passionate in pursuit of success & building positive relationships with customers and colleagues. You possess strong business acumen to spot opportunities for OCI- Dedicated region where others see none. You are articulate & have phenomenal communication/presentation skills. You thrive in a team environment & have a flair bringing large teams together for a shared purpose. You enjoy sharing ideas and best practices.
Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It's when everyone's voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what's been done before. That's why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

job_description:
Rakuten Group, Inc. is the largest e-commerce company in Japan, and third largest e-commerce marketplace company worldwide, with over 1.5 billion registered users worldwide. The Rakuten brand is recognized worldwide for its leadership and innovation, and provides a variety of consumer and business-focused services including e-commerce, e-reading, travel, banking, securities, credit card, e-money, portal and media, online marketing and professional sports. The company is expanding globally and currently has operations throughout Asia, Western Europe, and the Americas.
Rakuten Viki is a premier global entertainment streaming site where millions of people discover and consume primetime shows and movies subtitled in more than 200 languages, by our community of fans. With billions of videos viewed and more than 1 billion words translated, Viki brings global entertainment to fans everywhere!
About the SRE Team:
The SRE team at Viki is responsible for building infrastructure for the large distributed components that run Viki. We develop and maintain services that power Viki's API and business intelligence, as well as make architecture changes to scale them. We handle everything from Performance engineering, Cost optimisation, Security, Reliability engineering to Configuration and deployment pipelines
Based in Singapore, reporting to the SRE manager, the Staff Engineer, Security role will specifically focus on improving the security at Viki. You will be working on improving both the infrastructure and application security, perform threat modelling exercises and train other engineers on security first mindset.
Key Responsibilities Include:
Lead security initiatives within the organisation and help define roadmap with CISO
Help harden the infrastructure and application security
Integrate security validations and other tooling into CI/CD pipelines
Lead threat modelling discussions with stakeholders for various subsystems
Improve the application security by defining secure coding guidelines and training the other engineers about security best practices, integrating security into architecture
Lead risk assessment initiatives across multiple domains
Improve the infrastructure security by helping implement the relevant cloud environment's security best practices
Respond to security incidents
Lead the efforts for different Compliance requirements and audits
Requirements:
6+ years of relevant industry experience in Security in any area
Good knowledge of practical operating system knowledge around Unix/Linux
Strong knowledge of networking protocols
Strong knowledge of networks, web applications and API security
Familiarity with at least one Cloud Computing environment (GCP or AWS).
Familiarity with Docker/Kubernetes or any equivalent systems.
Familiarity with at least one high level programming language, preferably Go, Ruby, Python or Node.js
Preferred Qualifications:
Prior experience with API and web applications security either on defense or offense side.
Rakuten is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for an experienced Partner Development Manager (PDM) to lead one of our strategic Global System Integrators (GSI). As a PDM within AWS, you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of the AWS cloud computing platform with one of our largest partners. Responsibilities include: development and execution of partner strategy; owning the executive relationships with key partners, creating pipeline, driving sales execution, empowering large cloud practices and much more.

By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, along with managing the day-to-day interactions, you will be responsible for driving top line revenue growth and overall market adoption. The ideal candidate will possess business/channel sales background that enables them to engage at the MD/ VP/ CEO level, as well as a sales background that enables them to grow pipeline. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Experience working with enterprise large partners to develop and execute a partnering strategy, training, and joint sales and Go to Market (GTM) programs.
Engage the partner field sales organization, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for both parties.
Define a strategic Partner Plan and ensure it's in line with the AWS strategic direction. This includes developing establishing a process to track the progress toward goals.
Set and manage revenue targets and work with the partners and AWS sales organizations to achieve/exceed goals.
Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using AWS.
Experience with CRM systems, data warehousing and other analytic tools to establish detailed metrics for tracking purposes.
Deliver strategic business reviews to the senior leadership team.
Manage complex contract negotiations involving legal, marketing and business terms.
Position based in Singapore.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of sales and/or partner development experience in the software/technology industry.
Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
Influence and manage internal & external stakeholders to work together for a common goal
Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics, with hands on experience negotiating enterprise contracts
Strong language (English) public speaking and writing skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences
Strong technical and/or business solutions acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/ disruptive technologies
Ability to think and work creatively to develop unique joint value propositions and product strategy within AWS and in the partner's organization
Ability to think big, be bold, set clear multi-year partnership direction
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Prior experience in large scale, enterprise sales, partner/channel sales and/or business development roles
Prior experience working with/for GSIs in customer facing roles

Experience using Salesforce.com, Excel, Tableau and other data & analytics business tool

OneConnect is a fast growing financial technology company, focusing on providing cloud computing and other technology services to small and medium sized financial institutions. OneConnect has developed world-class technology innovations in areas, such as facial recognition, voiceprint, micro-expression recognition, and blockchain. To date, OneConnect has served over 600 banks, over 80 insurance companies and over 4,000 non-bank financial institutions.
At OneConnect we've worked hard to create a culture that will challenge, excite, and support your professional development. With frequent team events, extensive mentoring and training, and collaboration opportunities you'll instantly become part of the well-respected sourced family. Relevant technical background to understand concepts on insurance industry.

Our Data Analytics Team:

On a day to day basis, we help to translate strategy into specific strategic initiatives and take these initiatives from concept to execution. We are at the heart of digitization journey with our Data platform (PRU DataHub) acting as a single source of truth to drive the enterprise wide data analytics needs. We use Qlik as the BI platform to deliver quality solutions to our clients and partners.

In this role, you will work as a Qlik Developer within the Data Analytics team in implementing an enterprise-wide strategic initiative using the BI platform with following responsibilities:
Build data ingestion pipelines to bring in wide variety of data from multiple sources within the organization as well as from social media and public data sources.

Organized, methodical thinker with the ability to prioritize tasks.
Aptitude, interest and self-motivation to continually learn new tools and techniques.

job_description:
Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for world class candidates to lead and manage our partnerships with leading systems integrators, interactive agencies, and management consulting firms in ASEAN. Do you have the business savvy and industry expertise necessary to position Amazon as the technology platform of the future

As a Windows Partner Development Manager within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mindshare and adoption of Amazon's infrastructure web services (Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and a host of other Amazon Web Services) across AWS's most strategic business partners and their customers. Your responsibility will be to drive executive and field relationships with leading SI consulting firms on a national scale. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships and managing the day-to-day interactions with these partners, you will be responsible for driving top line Windows revenue growth and overall end customer adoption across all market segments. The ideal candidate will possess a business background that enables them to engage at the CXO level, a sales background that enables them to easily interact with Enterprise customers and sales/field reps, and the ability to engage with a partner across multiple geographies and within multiple vertical markets to achieve results. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, and to build and convey compelling customer value propositions around running Windows workloads on AWS.

Key Responsibilities:

- Work with a targeted group of global, national, or regional systems integrator partners to define and execute high impact joint sales and go-to-market programs that promote Windows on AWS.
- Manage and drive joint Windows sales engagements between partners and AWS sales teams.
- Serve as a key member of the Windows Partner Development team in helping to define and deliver the joint solution set and supporting collateral.
- Engage the partner's field sales organization, channels and end customers to create and drive Windows revenue opportunities for AWS.
- Set a strategic business development plan for target markets with assigned Partner management teams, and ensure alignment with the AWS strategic direction.
- Execute the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. service teams, legal, support, etc.).
- Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using AWS.
- Position AWS for internal use by the partner organization.
- Work closely with the partner's customer base to ensure they are successful using AWS services, making sure they have the technical resources required.
- Ensure that AWS is the partner's preferred cloud computing platform across all product lines.
- Understand the technical requirements of our partners and work closely with the internal development team to guide the direction of our product offerings.
- Prepare targeted communications to AWS and partner teams including field sales, solutions architects, business development and other interested parties in partner's capabilities and successes.
- Understand and exploit the use of salesforce.com and other internal Amazon systems.
- Prepare and give periodic business reviews to the AWS senior management team.
- Manage complex contract negotiations and serve as a liaison to the legal group.
- Ability to work with AWS partner solution architects to help assigned partners to define go to market solution offerings utilizing the AWS service portfolio.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
- 7+ years of sales, business development and program management experience.
- Presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences.
- Experience working within the enterprise software development industry is highly desired.
- Prior experience working with Microsoft preferred.
- Prior experience working with Global Systems Integrators.
- Willingness to travel up to 50% of time to US based partner offices (in accordance to specific country entry guidelines).
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
- Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics.
- Prior experience working with Systems Integrators and Consulting Companies to drive sales.
- Experience working with Microsoft field sales reps and customers.
- Experience working with Microsoft Windows solutions preferred.

Work with AWS & Global sales managers and your partner to define and execute joint sales and go to market programs.

Serve as a key member of the business development team in helping to define and deliver the joint solution set and supporting collateral for industry and service campaigns.
Engage the partner's field sales organization, channels, and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS.
Set a strategic business development plan for target market segments and ensure it is in-line with the AWS strategic direction.
Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using AWS.
Work closely with the partner's customer base to ensure they are successful using our web services, making sure they have the technical resources required.
Ensure that AWS is the partner's preferred cloud computing platform across all product lines.
Understand the technical and capability requirements of our partners and work closely with internal training and certification teams to equip the partner to deliver outcomes on AWS for their clients.
Operational Excellence, the ability to identify the key data to manage the Alliance, prepare and present business reviews to senior executive management teams both at the partner and AWS.

About the team
Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced lifeboth in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
High Business level proficiency in English, written and spoken
7+ years of sales, business development and/or partner management experience.
Previous experience working for, or working closely with, a global system integrator.
Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics.
Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives.
Strong presentation, written and operational skills coupled with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences.
Experience working within the cloud category is highly desired.
Proven experience driving revenue through partners with structured programs
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master's Degree in business or related field
Visible IT industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT infrastructure, professional services, outsourcing, and cloud adoption
Experience building workforce capabilities in/with large system integrators
Broad based technology experience including cloud computing, data, AI/ML, networking, security, storage and ongoing infrastructure management
Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

job_description:
About Asendia:
Asendia combines the experience of and expertise of our found companies, La Poste and Swiss Post. As a joint venture, we bring together a wealth of international and local expertise and connections. Today we employ over 1,000 people in 17 country offices in Europe, Asia, Oceania, and USA a global network blended with a local presence. Asendia vision is to deliver on our promise to make cross-border e-commerce and mail easy and reliable, worldwide. In Asendia APAC, we continue to tap on the growing e-commerce market in the region and our home markets in EU through our efficient and dependable delivery and returns services.
About Position:
In this position, you will hold a dual role in joining the regional and global team IT department to maintain and implement current and new infrastructure technologies. This role will manage overall infrastructure and technical development for the company. You are, to be required, part of the Virtual Team of Asendia Group IT Infrastructure Services. You will oversee designing, implementing, and administrating related policies, structure, tools, and services at Group level. That includes Group Network & Security and Identity & Access management services.
You will be the main liaison person to take charge in IT security and data policy across APAC subsidiaries, inclusive of upholding the task to guide APAC subsidiaries through the assessment and documentation process for GDPR and Data Protection Policy. You will be based in Singapore office and take charge of the management of IT infrastructure and services locally there as well, supported by local staff resources.
Tasks & Responsibilities:
Manage infrastructure projects, tasks and project management resource including the responsibility for timely and on-budget planning and delivery.
Develop and maintain an infrastructure strategic plans that supports the business long term objectives.
Lead IT and Operations staff in the design, development, and delivery of enterprise IT infrastructure.
Work with all areas of IT to ensure compliance to information security audit requirements.
Stay abreast of advances in technology, set clear team and individual goals.
Group/Local Systems Administration: AD Domain controller, Network Meraki Global, Security Suite, ADFS/SSO platform configuration, SFTP administration account, Back up process.
Group Systems Support Oerations
- Monitoring, service review
- Level 2/3 support, allow around the clock service
Experience & Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in IT/Computer Science or equivalent with minimum 5 years of progressive experience in IT infrastructure project management and project implementation.
Strong knowledge of Server (Windows) technologies, virtualization technologies, cloud computing (AWS/Azure) and Microsoft 365.
A background working on data centre and enterprise systems is a key.
Strong grasp of IT infrastructure concepts, implementation, and management of server management tools.
Strong independent worker with solution-oriented approach skills towards problem solving.
Track record of managing corporate IT Infrastructure and IT security implementation.
Familiar with GDPR and DPP Policy and participate in implementing and deploy changes, aligned to the requirement of the policy.
Fluent English, written and spoken

company: Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Data Analysis  Analytical Skills  Strategy  Program Management  Written Communications  Project Management  Driving Results  Consulting  Business Development
job_description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS Cloud enables customers of all sizes and industries to run their applications on Amazon's cloud computing infrastructure, and to drive innovation which helps transform their businesses. The SMB APJ segment team is one of the most exciting, fast moving and diverse customer segments within AWS. Our role is to develop programs and drive initiatives across Sales, Partner and Marketing to support the growth objectives of our Small-Medium Business (SMB) customer segment across APJ.

The AWS Program Management team defines, builds, launches, and delivers the programs our global customers use every day. We are looking for a leader with experience in program strategy and roadmap development and prioritization and getting things done. S/he should be a self-starter that thrives in ambiguity, with the ability to influence multi-functionally, and the willingness to roll up sleeves to operate in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate is someone with a demonstrated history of successfully owning and managing large, complex problems and engaging with cross-functional teams, and numerous stakeholders up to senior levels, directly and through influence.

As a Strategic Initiatives Program Manager for SMB, you'll be expected to focus on envisioning, experimenting, creating and operationalizing programs that will impact the APJ SMB customers at scale. You'll be responsible for anticipating bottlenecks, making tradeoffs, and welcoming an acceptable level of risk to maximize business benefit. You will own the execution and program management of strategic initiatives by collaborating with cross-functional work stream owners and reporting progress, updates, challenges, and solutions to leaders.

If you enjoy creating and managing programs that will have big impact on an organization, this is the role for you.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of program management, business development, consulting or client facing experience
Experience effectively managing, influencing, negotiating, and communicating with business partners and internal teams on program performance.
Experience engaging with C-Level executives, senior executives, and working across internal and external organization
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in building strategic processes at a global level.
Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insights
Global experience with program launches in multiple geographies simultaneously.
Track record of taking ownership and driving results
Understanding of the cloud ecosystem and experience in working with the small and medium business customers.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Thoughtworks is hiring developers with a passion to build their career in Data Engineering via our Data Guild Program.
The Thoughtworks Data Guild is a new program supported under the IMDA's TeSA Company-Led Training Program (CLT). The Data Guild is a 1 year contract program for aspiring software developers who are passionate about building a specialisation in Data Engineering.. Structured training and hands-on project exposure will be provided to candidates selected for the job.
What you will gain:

3 months of structured training where you'll be coached and mentored by experienced Data Engineers
Learn to translate tech to business value through hands-on projects
High conversion rate to permanent employees of Thoughtworks

Good Object-Oriented skills, including knowledge of design patterns.
Aware of software best practices like Test-Driven Development (TDD), SOLID and Continuous Integration (CI)

Working knowledge of Scala - basic understanding of the syntax.
Have an interest in Agile Methodologies, such as Extreme Programming (XP) and Scrum.

Subject to relevant selection and qualifying process.
Open to Singaporeans who are early professionals with minimum 3 years of working experience

job_title: Principal Technical Advisor - FastTrack for Azure
tech_stack: Microsoft Azure  Azure  Cloud Computing  Scrum  Artificial Intelligence  Customer Success  Project Delivery  Data Analysis  Autonomy  Conflict Resolution  Transportation  Tpm  Bridge  motions
job_description:
Azure Customer Experience (CXP) is a fast-growing engineering organization comprised of passionate individuals that drive positive outcomes and experiences, providing technical guidance, advice, and practical solutions. Within the organization, FastTrack for Azure (FTA) is a customer success service to help confidently adopt Azure and cloud best practices, applying a build it right, architect it right, the first time approach. FTA provides expert engineering resources, tools, and a methodical proven engagement process that facilitates the cloud journey for companies around the world.
As part of FTA's expansion efforts, we are building the office of the Chief Technical Advisor, which will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and expertly summarizing knowledge acquired from hundreds of customer engagements, helping Azure engineering teams to prioritize development and improvement efforts for the different cloud services that we offer. The team will also be driving motions to amplify and accelerate knowledge inside the organization, while taking into consideration the latest industry trends. Based on this mission, we are looking for a well-rounded, highly skilled cloud engineer who can act as a recognized technical advisor, with the ability to distill complex problems into clean and intuitive designs, in topics such as computer processing services, data analysis, artificial intelligence, networking, cybersecurity, and IoT messaging.
Responsibilities
Act as an expert cloud technical advisor to both Azure engineering and FastTrack for Azure teams around the world, providing practical advice and insights based on personal experience and latest trends.
In collaboration with other FTA teams, gather, analyze, and expertly summarize technical knowledge acquired from real-world customer engagements and feedback, helping Azure engineering teams and senior executives to prioritize development and improvement efforts.
Identify, design, and promote initiatives to amplify and accelerate knowledge acquisition inside the global FTA organization, helping with the prioritization of training efforts.
Directly participate in customer engagements where specialized expertise is required, offering technical guidance to solve complex problems with clean, intuitive designs and solutions.
Qualifications
Demonstrated deep technical capabilities as an expert technical advisor, primarily for cloud development on the Microsoft Azure platform.
A deep understanding of cloud computing technologies, and emerging trends.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in software engineering and development.
Knowledge of solution development practices and a track record of working closely with large development teams.
Proven record of building and growing technical relationships with senior executives.
Exceptional leadership skills and community building.
Exceptional decision-making, conflict resolution, and follow through.
Results driven; strong analytical skills with exceptional verbal and written communication.
BS/BA degree, Masters in Computer Science preferred.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job_description:
Work Here. Transform Everywhere.
The most advanced companies in the world turn to VMware to manage, grow and transform their business. When you work here, you're connected to a global community of innovative, empowered employees working together to solve the most critical technology challenges. Here, your talents are amplifiedfor the good of your career and the good of each other. Here, you're surrounded by a culture of possibility, where ideas ripple out and have a positive impact on customers and communities everywhere.
가장 앞 기업 VMware와 하여 즈니스를 관리하 장하며 합니다. VMware 하면 여러 가장 한 기 과를 해결하기 해 함께 하 능 갖춘 로 구 글로벌 커뮤니티 니다. 여기, 여러 재능 확대어 경과 료 게 모 으로 용합니다. 여러 어가 파급어 모 과 커뮤니티 향 미치 가능 문 심 하게 니다.
This role preferably requires an ability to read, write, and speak Korean.
Why will you enjoy this new opportunity
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 500,000 Enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and cloud technologies, VMware simplifies complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, and the network, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace. Our team of 34,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
The VMware Global Account Program serves approximately 100 of VMware's largest customers. These premier accounts are managed by a team of experienced Global Account Managers (GAM) with the objective to establish a significant VMWare footprint in the largest and most influential corporations worldwide. Our selling is focused on our customers primary business initiatives and connecting our value to our customers business value. Our Value Selling strategy is the investment of time, talent and technology from VMWare and our partners to invent (transform) our customers business for their benefit.
The Inside Sales Global Account Manager (iGAM) role supports the sales efforts our Global account program and resides within our Inside Sales organization. The Inside Sales organization is a fast-paced demand generation engine responsible for driving incremental growth for the VMware sales organization. We're looking for people who love to win, have strong business ethics and great communication skills. If you have the ambition to learn new technologies, drive sales, and deliver results, this may be the role for you.
VMware 50만 개 즈 SMB 우 시대 공 수 있 지하 가 우 루션 기업입니다. 가 우 기 구 VMware 반 가 업무 공 트워 르 복잡 단순하여 소트웨어 루션 통해 하브리 우 컴팅 모 업무 공 르 역량 강합니다. 50개 근무하 34,000명 팀 열, , 실행, 팀워, 극 학습 기부 가치를 실천하면 뛰어 람 오랫안 하 싶어하 커뮤니티를 만기 해 노하 있습니다. 가하 하며 주 준가 셨다면 지금 로 미래 약 항과 문 해결 해 우리와 함께하.
VMware Global Account Program VMware 가장 약 100여개 기업게 스를 공합니다. 러한 리미어 가장 향 있 기업 규모 VMware 루션 구축하 경험 부한 Global Account Managers로 구 팀 해 관리니다. 우리 주 즈니스 니티브 초 맞 우리 가치를 즈니스 가치와 연결하 하 있습니다. 우리 가치 매 략 VMware 파트 시, 재 기 투하여 한 즈니스를 개발()하 것입니다.
iGAM(Inside Sales Global Account Manager) 우리 글로벌 어카운트 로그램 지하 Inside Sales 조 해 있습니다. Inside Sales 조 VMware 업 조 장 른 페스 수 창출 근입니다. 승부를 좋하, 기업윤리가 강하며, 커뮤니케션 역량 뛰어 찾습니다. 새로운 기 배우 즈를 며 결과를 하 열 있다면, 역 여러께 맞 역입니다.
Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing
The iGAM supports multiple global accounts World Wide with accountability on the sub $250K business in conjunction with strong teaming and collaboration skills and the ability to leverage and share best practices across accounts. The role commands an understanding of the aligned GAMs (Global Account Managers) account strategy and working closely with all remote teams WW. The iGAM prospects, generates, qualifies, quotes and follows up on assigned leads and campaigns and coordinates accurate and timely home and landed updates on pipeline and forecast. The role requires the ability to leverage disparate teams within VMware to support the GAM or GAE in the presentation of a strategic and/or tactical proposal (e.g., IB renewals, etc.). The iGAM must be proficient in sales tools, have the ability to lead relevant product campaigns (e.g., VMC) and provide coverage where landed resources aren't available and/or effective.

job_description:
This position is responsible for assisting internal staff with any information technology issues, including troubleshooting and cybersecurity support.
Description
Technical & Helpdesk Support, IT/Computer - Hardware, IT/Computer Network/System/Database Admin, IT/Computer - Hardware
Installation and configuration of office broadband, firewalls, servers, routers, and workstations, as well as office relocation.
Server and Storage Consolidation, Data Protection and Retention
Virtualization and Cloud Computing Solutions. Inventory control of laptops and licenses and maintain serial numbers.
To initiate approval and asset write-offs for IT equipment.
Monitoring, assigning, and purchase requisition laptops and licenses.
Evaluate the various PCs and laptops performance and support levels, and make any required recommendations for future purchases.
Assist with technical and help desk issues.
Setup a Virtual Private Network (VPN).
End-user support (Remote Access, Teamviewer support)
Conduct an internal compliance audit on a regular basis to prevent illegal software and program downloads.
Coordination of IT Compliance and Audits
Review and improve company IT Policy
Drive Security Awareness
Keep laptops in good working order for troubleshooting, security, and other purposes.
Responsible for cybersecurity of our system
Requirement:
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science and /or with IT-related discipline in relevant professional certifications.
Minimum of three years experience working in an IT security-related capacity, with a thorough awareness of cybersecurity frameworks and standards.
Automation Champion. Network Supervision.
Citizens of Singapore are encouraged to apply.

tech_stack: Ui Design  Cloud Computing  HTML  Interaction Design  Agile  Application Development  Javascript  Replication  Adobe Xd  Software Development  Higher Education  Tape  XD  Windows Operating Systems
job_description:
Mendix is a low-code app development platform:
First, what is low-code Low-code is a visual approach to software development that enables you to abstract and automate every step of the application lifecycle. Gartner predicts that by 2024, low-code application development will be responsible for more than 65% of application development activity. Mendix is repeatedly ranked a Leader in analyst reports from Gartner and Forrester. In the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Multiexperience Development Platforms, Mendix placed at the very top of the Leaders quadrant.
Mendix, the global leader in enterprise low-code, was created to promote collaboration between Business & IT teams. Thousands of forward-thinking companies around the world like Ford Auto, Rabobank Netherlands, Zurich Insurance, and Red Bull, can unleash their best ideas faster with the help of the Mendix Platform.
Mendix is a Siemens Business:
Siemens is a Top 10 Global Software Company and a leader on Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies in the World! With the acquisition of Mendix in 2018, Siemens Digital Industries Software is driving transformation to enhance the digital enterprise where engineering, manufacturing and electronics meet the future of innovation. Mendix employees have the opportunity to work in a hyper-growth environment with the support of Siemens unbeatable market position and resources.
Responsibilities:
Educating our customers/prospects on the capabilities of our front-end development, UI design, and platform
Advising our customers/prospects on how to leverage UX within their application portfolio and organization.
Designing UIs for applications by leveraging a client's existing brand assets
Communicating best practices with respect to UI designs
Working collaboratively with the extended Solutions Architecture team to deliver compelling UIs on top of functional proof of concepts
Developing applications through use of the Mendix Studio Pro and UI design tools
Multitasking on challenging agile projects simultaneously
Requirements:
Higher education experience in user interaction design or graphical design
Over 3 years of work experience as a front-end developer and UI designer ideally within an Agile environment
Experienced in designing mobile friendly websites and web-based applications
Demonstrated front-end development experience
Demonstrated experience building UI deliverables such as wireframes, design mockups user workflows, functional specifications, and/or style guides.
A solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and Sass
Experienced with proven UI design tool such as Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD
Basic understanding of JavaScript is a plus
This role may required travelling up to 50% to APAC countries
Working at Mendix
Mendix has been recognized as a Best Cloud Computing Company to Work For by Forbes. With offices in 16+ countries including headquarters in Rotterdam and Boston, Mendix provides an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.
While each employee brings their own unique cultures and personalities to the workplace, we collectively live by our Mendix Blue Guiding Principles:
While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our MendixBlue guiding principles. Being MendixBlue means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It's kind of a big deal.
We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, alwaysyou belong here.
We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long termyou belong here.
We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask what if and work to find a way or make oneyou belong here.
We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you're up for learning from your failuresyou belong here.
We hear every voice. Inflated egos don't last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win regardless of who they come fromyou belong here.
We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it doneyou belong here.
We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we're happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you doyou belong here.

company: Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
tech_stack: Microsoft  Azure  Cloud Computing  Amazon Web Services  Solution Architecture  Networking  SQL Server  Windows  Technical Leadership  Dns  Software Development  Firewalls  Architect  Active Directory  architects  Consulting
job_description:
Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures

As a Senior Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects; defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform; and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced lifeboth in and outside of work.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Technical studies or equivalent related job experience
6+ years IT experience that includes at least 4 years of hands-on .NET software development, Windows infrastructure, or SQL database architecture.
2+ years of internal or external customer engagement in an architecture role, pre-sales, or consulting.
Some travel required up to 30% of the time
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we're happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you doyou belong here.

tech_stack: Change Management  Cloud Computing  Application Development  Customer Success  Saas  Professional Services  Leadership  Customer Loyalty  Customer Engagement  Account Management Experience  customer education  Advocate  Articulate  Decision Making  Electronics
job_description:
Mendix is a low-code app development platform:
First, what is low-code Low-code is a visual approach to software development that enables you to abstract and automate every step of the application lifecycle. Gartner predicts that by 2024, low-code application development will be responsible for more than 65% of application development activity. Mendix is repeatedly ranked a Leader in analyst reports from Gartner and Forrester. In the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Multiexperience Development Platforms, Mendix placed at the very top of the Leaders quadrant.
Mendix, the global leader in enterprise low-code, was created to promote collaboration between Business & IT teams. Thousands of forward-thinking companies around the world like Ford Auto, Rabobank Netherlands, Zurich Insurance, and Red Bull, can unleash their best ideas faster with the help of the Mendix Platform.
Mendix is a Siemens Business:
Siemens is a Top 10 Global Software Company and a leader on Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies in the World! With the acquisition of Mendix in 2018, Siemens Digital Industries Software is driving transformation to enhance the digital enterprise where engineering, manufacturing and electronics meet the future of innovation. Mendix employees have the opportunity to work in a hyper-growth environment with the support of Siemens unbeatable market position and resources.
We're investing to accelerate our momentum, and we're looking to grow our APJ Team. If you constantly strive for excellence, are passionate about innovation, and want to work with a collaborative, energetic team - then Mendix is for you.
Your Mission:
To be the trusted adviser to our Enterprise customers, driving business value through the use of our cloud platform. You will play a crucial role in engaging with customers to provide our best practices to quickly realize the value of our solutions.
Essential Functions
Drive Outcomes for the Customer and our Business
Be intimately aware of focus areas, priorities and metrics for each quarter
Know your portfolio, and articulate opportunities for positive outcomes: expansion, retention focus, and maturity progression
Customer Engagement
Inspiring customer loyalty by becoming a trusted adviser
Identifying and building strong customer champions
Understanding the client decision making process and organization structure
Lead customer through their own customer journey leveraging best practices and expert advice
Deliver true value for customers
Be an expert on best practices in change management
Be a Challenger to the status quo and emphatically lead change
Identify and define successful deployment strategies
Continually learn new features and functionality of the platform and how they create value for the customer
Cross Functional Leadership
Align with Sales and Expert Services on expansion and renewals
Lead cross-functionally to drive customer success
Advocate for changes in other departments ways of working and collaborate with them to implement those changes
Cultivates and engages in a culture of partnership and collaboration
Skills and Abilities Required:
Proven experience driving adoption, renewal and expansion with Enterprise accounts
Successful track record of working with Partners and through the partner eco-system to drive option and expansion
Strong technical foundation and ability to explain with purpose how technology drives business value to a variety of stakeholders with different responsibilities to the business
Experience and understanding of the application development lifecycle strongly preferred
Ability to analyze and breakdown complex situations, develop action plans and lead cross functional team to key objectives
Exceptional executive-level communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
Fosters and engages in a culture of teamwork and collaboration
Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented and highly organized
Analytical and metrics-driven work style
Self-starter who thrives under ambiguity in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment
Passion for continuously learning new technology and being able to provide value to the customer
Education and Experience Requirement:
8-10 plus years of consulting and/or SaaS based technical account management experience
Experience as the customer facing leader responsible for the management of successful Professional services operations for a fast-growing SaaS business or related technology. (Cloud Industry and IT Systems Management knowledge is strongly preferred)
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required; Master's Degree preferred
Working at Mendix
Mendix has been recognized as a Best Cloud Computing Company to Work For by Forbes. With offices in 16+ countries including headquarters in Rotterdam and Boston, Mendix provides an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.
While each employee brings their own unique cultures and personalities to the workplace, we collectively live by our Mendix Blue Guiding Principles:
While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our MendixBlue guiding principles. Being MendixBlue means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It's kind of a big deal.
We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, alwaysyou belong here.
We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long termyou belong here.
We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask what if and work to find a way or make oneyou belong here.
We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you're up for learning from your failuresyou belong here.
We hear every voice. Inflated egos don't last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win regardless of who they come fromyou belong here.
We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it doneyou belong here.
We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we're happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you doyou belong here.
