job_description:
As an Enterprise Cloud Architect, you will lead the conversation and direct the execution of the sales team by combining both technical vision and business insight. You will partner heavily with Sales Engineer, Infrastructure Modernization, in order to articulate the true total value of each technical solution and the overall business.
Responsibilities:
Build a trusted advisory relationship with accounts and engage with leadership. Identify customer priorities, technical objections, and design strategies encompassing the entire Google ecosystem to deliver business value and resolve blockers.
Provide domain expertise around public cloud and enterprise technology, and effectively promote Synpulse8 and Google Cloud with customers, at conferences, and online.
Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution.
Manage the holistic enterprise architecture relationship with customers by collaborating with specialists, product management, engineering, and more.
Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.
Minimum qualifications:
Experience in the cloud market, competitive dynamics, and customer buying behaviours.
Experience as an enterprise architect in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
Experience in cloud computing and the financial sector
Preferred qualifications:
Experience with structured Enterprise Architecture practices, hybrid cloud deployments, and on-premise-to-cloud migration deployments and roadmaps.
Experience in network infrastructure, security, and application development.
Experience in building, architecting, designing, and implementing distributed global cloud-based systems.
Knowledge of technology solutions, and the ability to learn/understand emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT technology space.
Experience with legacy and modern application development, cloud service delivery, and deployment.
Experience with application development technologies, architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable and secure distributed systems.
Experience with Relational Databases, NoSQL Databases, and/or Big Data technologies and containers.
Understanding of IaaS, PaaS, FaaS (XaaS).

job_description:
Handshakes by DC Frontiers is an award-winning DataTech company that leverages data to empower safe, informed business decisions. We are located in 7 cities and are expanding our presence across the globe.
We are hiring for an experienced Senior Data Engineer to be part of our Data Engineering team in our Singapore office. The Senior Data Engineer will be part of our highly talented and motivated Data and AI Team.
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing resilient and scalable data pipelines. With your years of experience, you will partner with the different pillars of the Data and AI, Engineering, and Product teams to meet their data engineering needs.
The Senior Data Engineer will have responsibilities such as, but not limited to:
Building, deploying and managing data solutions that are scalable and efficient for a growing data driven company
Build out scalable and reliable ETL pipelines and processes for data injection of a large number of data from various data sources
Architect and design data infrastructure on cloud
Mentor more junior engineers
As an experienced Senior Data Engineer, you would have:
More than 5 years of working experience in a data engineering role
Demonstrated experience in building large-scale applications using open-source technologies and/or distributed processing platforms like Spark, Airflow, Hadoop in a product setting
Hands on experience with data engineering tools and platforms such as Kafka, Spark and Hadoop
Proficiency in multiple programming / scripting languages such as Python, Java or Scala and with a good understanding of runtime complexities

tech_stack: Kubernetes  Oracle  Azure  Cloud Computing  Scrum  Shell Scripting  MySQL  Tuning  Configuration Management  Selenium  Architect
job_description:
About Us
PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity, and open collaboration while having fun doing it.
Started in France in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Australia, Hong Kong, Thailand, and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our talents in Singapore.
At PALO IT, our employees are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more!
Our Vision and Values
We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organizations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good.
We Care about our World
We Act with Courage
We Share, it's in our DNA
We Choose Positivity & Self Improvement
We Deliver Awesomeness
YOU:
The DevOps Architect will install, maintain, and support an on-premises cloud infrastructure and apply DevOps practices and solutions. The person will also implement cloud-related and DevOps technologies such as AWS/Puppet/Chef/Elk/Azure/Openstack. Other infrastructure related activities such as maintaining the company internal server infrastructure and respond to consultant requests when required will be expected.
Install, maintain, and support on-premises and off-premises cloud stack.
Configure, maintain, and support the cloud-related infrastructures.
Act as a system administrator on different OSes (e.g. RHEL, Opensolaris, Ubuntu, etc.) and help teams deploy their application and automate their development and releases on the cloud.
Ability to develop solutions and self-learn new tools and technologies.
Document, and share knowledge on developed DevOps solutions.
STILL YOU:
Good Unix / Linux / Bash knowledge
In-depth understanding of cloud computing (e.g. Technologies, Deployment, costing, HA/DR, etc.)
Good understanding of DevOps principles (e.g. testing automation, BDD, TDD, Release automation, CI/CD, etc.)
2 years experience with cloud deployment (e.g. Openstack, VMWare, AWS, Azure, Terraform, etc.)
1 year experience with testing automation (e.g. Maven, Selenium, HP QC, LoadRunner)
1 year experience with release automation process (e.g. CA-RA, Jenkins, etc.)
1 year experience with Configuration Management (e.g. Ansible, SaltStack, Puppet/Chef, etc.)
1 year experience with monitoring tools (e.g. ELK, Prometheus, Grafana and Splunk)
Experience with developing and implementing processes to handle releases from
Development to Operations while respecting internal rules, and offering solutions for rollback)
Experience with designing an architecture to implement development-to-production workflows.
Knowledge of SRE, Containers, Kubernetes, Openshift is a plus.
Good understanding of microservice architecture and DevOps practices that support.
Strong RDMS and NoSQL skill in deploying and fine tuning such as MySQL, Oracle, Elasticsearch.
Your technical environment
# Cloud and DevOps based technologies (AWS/Puppet/Chef/ELK/Azure/Opencloud)
# DevOps practices
# Linux OS, Shell Scripting, SQL
# Agile and scrum environment
Your role at PALO IT
You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company.
If you like what you just read, we'd love to have a chat with you!
We might not be able to get back to every applicant but we promise your application will be reviewed by one of our recruitment experts.
PALO IT Singapore is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions will be based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Palo IT SG does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law.
Protecting your privacy and the security of your data are longstanding top priorities for Palo-IT.
Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Palo-IT's recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes.
Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.palo-it.com/en/privacy-policy) to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
Here you can find how you can request for access, correction and/or withdrawal of your Personal Data

job_description:
Role & Responsibilities
Design, develop and maintain software that powers M-DAQ systems.
Help design the architecture, own development of major initiatives and modules.
Work in cross functional teams with product managers, UX designers and QA engineers to ship software on-quality and on-time.
Help level up the team; share knowledge, conduct code and design review; drive code quality and process improvement initiatives.
Write code that you are proud of, with extensibility, scalability and performance in mind.
Requirements
Have a degree in computer science or an equivalent related field (bachelor's/master's).
3-4 years of server-side development using Java with a solid foundation in object-oriented analysis and design.
Experience in Spring framework(Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Batch, JPA)
Knowledge of TDD and Unit Testing frameworks.
Have experience working with SQL DBs, writing custom queries and designing schemas
Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS) is an added advantage.
Experience in the JavaScript ecosystem and used frameworks like ReactJS and Angular where you apply your in-depth knowledge in JavaScript and/or TypeScript.
Experience in service-oriented / microservices architectures (REST, SOAP)
Professional experience working in an agile development environment.
Soft skills
Start-up mindset
Understand and practices the 12 Agile principles & 4 core values as stated by the Agile Manifesto
Must be a team player, someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy in our flat organisational structure.
Someone who is really excited about problem solving and delivering innovative technology that carries real business value.
Ability to work hard and under pressure
Good communication skills in English
Always thinking of ways to improve current system
Willing to spend significant amount of time understanding the business in parallel with IT knowledge
Ability to solve problems in an efficient/innovative way

ABOUT EXODUSPOINT
ExodusPoint Capital, founded in 2017 by Michael Gelband and Hyung Lee, began managing investor capital in 2018. The firm employs a global multi-strategy investment approach, seeking to deliver compelling asymmetric returns by combining complementary liquid strategies managed by experienced investment professionals within a robust risk framework. ExodusPoint brings together an accomplished team with hands-on experience running multi-manager businesses to create an institutional investment management firm.
JOB DESCRIPTION
The Systems Engineering team works closely with application developers, portfolio managers and other technical teams to build and deploy core technology. We support a broad number of products and services across the public cloud and on-prem environments.
The candidate will have the opportunity to gain exposure to hardware, operating systems, storage, virtualization, cloud and a variety of higher-level frameworks at the enterprise level.
Responsibilities:
Approach problems with an infrastructure as code (IAC) mindset
Automates tasks and implements scale out solutions to meet the growing business needs
Develops and implements technical solutions and processes to improve reliability and efficiency
Sets and meets project goals when implementing and integrating complex technology concepts
Interact with internal teams, Portfolio Managers and external vendors
Qualifications:
Hands-on experience with architecture, implementation and operation of a Linux based computing environment
In-depth depth knowledge of networking concepts, storage platforms, firewalls and load balancers
Proficient in at least one programming language such as, Python or Golang
Significant experience with some of the following: VMWare, AWS, Kubernetes, Kafka, Gitlab, Consul, Vault, Ansible or Saltstack

tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Data Management  Artificial Intelligence  Technical Leadership  Negotiation  Channel Partners  Customer Engagement  Channel  Selling  Public Speaking  Product Management  high performance computing  Business Development  Writing Skills
job_description:
NetApp: The Cloud Storage Specialists
NetApp is telling a new story. One deeply rooted in innovation and market leadership yet building a reputation of strong growth in the cloud. One that speaks to customers, prospects, analysts, media and employees in a clear simple manner. One that expounds the advantages of working with a customer-first, cloud-led data-centric software company. The world has fundamentally changed since NetApp began its technology journey 21 years ago in Australia. Our customers have more complex challenges for an increasingly diverse and dynamic data driven world. And we take pride in our long history as an industry leader yesterday and today. We have a huge opportunity in a quickly growing market. We have the right technology, services, and culture to win with existing customers and prospects right now.
Do You Know the New NetApp
We are a Cloud led, data management software company. We have shifted from an infrastructure-led discussion to a Hybrid Multi-Cloud Software-led discussion. At NetApp our singular focus is to help our customers unlock the best of Cloud. NetApp is delivering huge value for enterprises undergoing digital transformation. In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. We're focused on one thing; helping organisations get the most out of their data. NetApp brings enterprise-grade data services into the cloud, and the simple flexibility of cloud into the data centre. Our industry-leading solutions work across diverse customer environments and the world's biggest public clouds. As a cloud-led, data-centric software company, NetApp helps organisations to securely deliver the right data, services and applications to the right peopleanytime, anywhere.
What You'll be Doing...
Job Summary
You have broad and deep experience in both the business and technical aspects of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) and rich experience understanding and influencing both storage and compute technology choices for AI/ML/DL infrastructures. Have experience in understanding customer requirements and business use cases and proposing solutions accordingly. Able to help AI business leaders and technologists accelerate the adoption of these new technologies within their organizations and have deep experience to discuss data pipeline and data management challenges in AI/ML/DL initiatives and projects.
Job Requirements
The ideal candidate should possess technical and business expertise in AI and ML domain in general and more specifically in data pipeline management, data science project lifecycle management, and IT infrastructure requirements for AI/ML/DL project implementations. The ideal candidate should also have strong background and understanding of AI business use cases across various strategic industry verticals such as Automotive, Healthcare, Retail and Finance. This role requires a strong passion for solving customers and partners current and future AI project challenges and help them achieve the required ROI by meeting their demands and proposing corresponding solutions. Most importantly, the job will have an essential requirement of building the channel partner ecosystem go-to-market strategy including but not limited to developing partner lead joint solutions. The ideal candidate should also possess high level negotiation skills to be able to position NetApp's value add among the competitive landscape.
Responsibilities
Build awareness by helping NetApp channel partners understand NetApp's AI/ML approach and value proposition Build AI/ML/DL Go-To-Market strategy plan with NetApp channel partners to develop joint vertical specialized AI solutions with 3rd party software/hardware to drive business demand and sales revenue Communicate internally and externally about NetApp's AI/ML approach, value proposition, and offerings Understand and uncover customers challenges in adopting AI/ML technologies, specifically those related to infrastructure and data management. Show how NetApp partner lead solutions help them overcome these challenges and accelerate their AI/ML/DL projects Help field teams understand AI/ML services and help customers successfully adopt them Generate demand by discussing business use cases with partners and customers and show the value add of adopting AI/ML/DL and related technologies within their specific industry Work closely with NetApp business units, sales and technical leadership teams to reflect customer/partner requirements and technical demands to build tailored programs and develop new integration points Work with sales and field teams on AI/ML campaigns and help implementing them
What you bring to the table...
Strong relevant business development experience, customer engagement experience and sales leadership in the IT domain
Experienced in AI/ML/DL and data science projects and technologies Strong written and verbal communication skills
Deep knowledge of cloud computing and cloud based AI/ML/DL services and offerings
Knowledge in computer and storage technology landscape in general
Previous engagements in High Performance Computing and parallel file systems projects
Understanding the intersection of technology and business and being comfortable with either audience
Developing close relationships with Field and Partner selling teams and earning their trust to help them close deals
Become a trusted technology advisor to the Field to coach on the viability of opportunities
Working with Product Management and Engineering to help them understand Field requirements
Confident public speaking at Industry events
Experience in channel ecosystem management such as building SKU's, forming and executing Go-To-Market Strategy with channel partners
In-depth experience in AI/ML/DL technology, data management challenges, and customer requirements
In-depth knowledge in AI/ML/DL business use cases and vertical based offerings
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Demonstrated ability to build and scale programs that meet customer's requirements and drive revenue demand
Strong organizational, presentation, and writing skills
What is Our Culture Like
We have a history of making our own rules in a good way. That's because we approach every challenge with fresh eyes. As a result, you'll find no cookie cutters in our kit, but we do like cookies. Customers say we push the limits above and beyond what they thought could ever be possible. We'll take that. It's a testament to our diversity, openness, and collaboration. When you choose to be at NetApp, you choose to become part of something bigger than yourself - you choose to be become integral to a diverse and inclusive culture that pursues boundless ambition in service of others. #OneNetApp. Powered by Together.
What's in it for You
NetApp is changing and transforming with a Talent-First mindset and evolution to a flexible hybrid work model; we are taking our best learnings from working remotely to emerge as a more productive, collaborative, inclusive and innovative culture. We advocate for and support our team members living balanced, healthy lives. We do this by offering flexible working options, paid parental leave, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, paid wellness re-charge days, comprehensive medical plans for you and your family, employee assistance programs and so much more. NetApp cares about your career journey and provides an unprecedented level of visibility into opportunities for career growth and development by giving you access to a best-in-class talent experience platform that will help you create YOUR NetApp career journey. Follow @LifeAtNetApp or NetApp: My Company | LinkedIn to discover more. (https://www.linkedin.com/company/netapp/mycompany/)
NetApp is proud to collaborate with WORK180 an international jobs network that connects smart businesses with talented women. Using regularly updated pre-screening criteria as well as diversity initiatives focused on age, ability, ethnicity and sexual orientation, WORK180 aligns with our commitment to a fair and equal workplace for everyone. See our full list of benefits and why we are recognised as an Endorsed Employer for Women by WORK180 here (https://au.work180.co/employers/netapp/about).
What Next
Perfection is not required if you're excited about this role and feel that you have relevant experience, but not sure if you meet 100% of the criteria please apply, we would love to speak with you! You can apply directly to the relevant job postings in LinkedIn our Careers page or via our Work180 profile (https://au.work180.co/employers/netapp/jobs).
Our Diversity Commitment
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to create a diverse, inclusive and belonged workforce. We welcome all applications without regard to their age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics). We pledge to take every reasonable step to ensure that our applicants and employees are respected, treated fairly and with dignity.
Privacy Disclosure
Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by NetApp. Your details will be stored on our Internal applicant tracking system for the purpose of recruitment which may include your details being shared with the Hiring Committee.

job_title: Senior Cyber Security Analyst (Data Loss Prevention)
tech_stack: Information Security  Cloud Computing  Cyber Security  Data Loss Prevention  Network Security  Able To Multitask  Security Operations  Troubleshooting  Defense  Investigation  Career Development  Risk Management  Compliance  Banking  Prevention  Loss Prevention
job_description:
JOB SCOPE
Summary of Job Responsibilities
The Cyber Security Operations Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Senior Analyst is an expert data leakage detection and prevention analyst within the Marina Bay Sands (MBS) Cyber Security Operations Centre.
The mission of DLP monitoring within MBS CSOC is to detect and prevent leakage of sensitive and confidential information via electronic means out from the organization.
The CSOC DLP senior analyst, If required, is also capable of providing focused effort and troubleshooting of technical issues that impact the CSOC DLP tool.
Job Responsibilities
Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job.
Detect, respond and / or escalate potential DLP incidents in a timely fashion.
Maintain and review MBS CSOC DLP tools so that they continue to be effective in detecting data loss incidents.
Operationalize new DLP tools introduced as part of Global CSOC initiatives into MBS CSOC environment.
Review and update DLP monitoring runbooks timely.
Collect, review, and analyze CSOC DLP metrics and trending, including the health of the DLP monitoring systems timely.
Ensure IT compliance within MBS CSOC DLP tools.
Ensure MBS CSOC DLP tools compliance to regulatory requirements.
Coordinate with other stakeholders to resolve cases, where required.
Performs other related DLP duties as assigned.
On-call for any technical issues affecting the availability of MBS CSOC DLP tools.
Key Tasks include:
Perform BAU daily review and monitoring of DLP alerts.
Prioritize DLP alerts, track and perform initial investigations, determine if the associated activity requires further investigation.
Assist in DLP technology and process improvement efforts.
Analyze trends and patterns in DLP activity.
Suggest refinement of DLP detection and prioritization capabilities.
Recommend measures to reduce the risk of data loss across all lines of business.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Degree or Diploma with at least 5-10 years of work experience in reviewing DLP alerts / events in a corporate environment.
Professional cyber security related membership / certification is preferred, but not a must.
Experience in Gaming, Banking or Critical Infrastructure InfoComm Industry is preferred, but not a must.
Proven effective verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge required:
Foundational knowledge of cybersecurity organization practices, operations, risk management processes, data confidentiality principles and incident response methodologies
Knowledge of Data Loss Prevention (DLP), potentially including experience developing risk aligned DLP monitoring rules, knowledge of DLP systems and products or experience on a security assurance operations team performing DLP triage operations functions.
Foundational knowledge of legal and government regulations as they relate to data security and confidentiality in specific, technology in general.
Cyber defense and information security policies and procedures.
Foundational knowledge of cloud computing and its associated data loss prevention control is preferable.
Knowledge and experience related to Insider Threat monitoring and operations is a plus.
Skills required:
Protecting a network against data leakage incidents.
Recommend and review adequacy of DLP monitoring rules.
Applying cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to data loss prevention).
Using incident handling methodologies in responding to potential data loss incidents.
Proficiency in the use of tools, staying current with skills, participating in multiple forums related to cybersecurity, Data Loss Prevention or Insider Threat.
Abilities required:
Ability to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to data loss prevention).
Investigative mindset and the ability to follow data and build a case.
Maintain an impeccable personal integrity and responsibility in the course of his / her work.

job_title: Business Development Representative, Prisma Cloud (Japanese speaking)
tech_stack: Cloud Security  Cloud Computing  Amazon Web Services  Cloud  Dns  Leadership  outbound sales  Hardware  Customer Contact  Public Sector  Working With Clients  Cold Calling  Email Marketing  Selling  Outbound Calling  Reliability  Pressure  Articulate  Business Development  Mis
job_description:
Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren't easy goals to accomplish but we're not here for easy. We're here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we're looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We're changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we've rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.

Your Career

We are looking for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our team and own the identification and development of quality sales opportunities for the Account Executive team by connecting with Inbound leads and doing outbound prospecting. Being a (BDR) is not an easy task and High-performers in this role can expect to advance their career in 12-18 months. Being a BDR means handling rejection well, but persevering, regardless. It means cold-calling, selling, and pitching our products to people who are under tremendous pressure to secure their digital environments. And it means sticking with it with a level of tenacity defined only by your commitment to seeing a sale through. Here is what you'll bring to the table:
Confidence - Willing to ask questions, always learning, have a strong work ethic, are persistent, and coachable
Craftsmanship - We are lifelong learners - We approach our work with curiosity and an open mind, never settling for good enough
Grit - We run towards challenges - If something seems unsolvable, it unleashes our persistence, our creativity, and our ability to move through uncertainty to create a solution
Energy - We embrace joy - We love what we do and bring our best selves to work each day - We seek to share our optimism and compassion with everyone around us
Becoming a part of the team means you will be surrounded by amazing, smart and hard working teammates - and that's a phenomenal place to be. Plus, the added bonus of changing the world! Now that's just icing on the cake.
Your Impact
Generate new business opportunities to fuel Prisma's pipeline and growth
Collaborate closely with marketing and account executives to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities
Manage and nurture inbound interest for Prisma Cloud's products and capabilities, conducting high-level discovery and educational conversations with key executives and influencers at target accounts
Utilize industry knowledge to research & develop accounts, identify key players, and generate interest
Do outbound prospecting to companies via cold calling, email, marketing campaigns, social selling
Learn and maintain in-depth knowledge of Prisma's products and capabilities
Your Experience
BS degree or equivalent practical experience
2+ years experience in inside sales or business development, sales or client development in a technology sales environment
Previous work experience in inbound and outbound calls and inquiries
Ability to understand technical concepts, possess enthusiasm for technology and to articulate clearly to all levels of technical aptitude
Ability to adapt quickly to a fast-paced environment
Track record of achieving sales quotas

The Team

Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.

As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won't find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn't committed to your success with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development.As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfilment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats.

Our Commitment

We're trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity's status quo. It's simple: we can't accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we've rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at [HIDDEN TEXT].

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Secure today, for a better tomorrow: https://www.youtube.com/watchv=8YF_nKUskeg

job_description:
About us
CloudCover is a cloud consulting, solutions, and managed services provider. We build enterprise-grade products that enhance the security posture and operational efficiency of the public cloud. We are an agile bunch of cloud native enthusiasts, data engineers, DevSecOps practitioners, product and solution architects, developers, designers, and project managers. Automation and experimentation are our foundational elements, and we specialize in DevSecOps, Big Data, AI/ML, SysOps, and SLA-driven services to support multi-cloud solutions.
Job Profile
Leading sales activities for CloudCover in the APAC market.
Driving all opportunities generated from AWS, Google and Microsoft for their APAC business and working with end customers to move towards closure.
Managing the sales relationship with end customers to drive cross-sell and upsell of CloudCover services through effective account management
Building strong working relationships with Partner Managers, Sales and Marketing teams and Technology Specialists
Work with Partner teams to generate opportunities for CloudCover Consulting and Managed Services
Prospecting and nurturing leads to drive net new business for CloudCover
Be a single point of contact between Microsoft, Amazon & Google end customers and the CloudCover team in your region.
Required Skills
Prior experience in Enterprise Sales and Account Management for customers in APAC.
Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills.
Understanding of Cloud Computing is a must.
Solution and Consultative Selling Mindset.
Strong communication skills
Preferred Skills
Experience with any Cloud Platform, preferably AWS (or GCP, Azure etc)
Partnership or Sell Through Experience.
BTech/BE
Opportunities in the Role
Gain strong working knowledge exposure to latest technologies: AWS, Azure, GCP
Work with a fast growing Cloud Consulting company expanding into new geographies
Opportunity to contribute own ideas and opinions with senior management
A fast career growth path within a fast track industry.

Automation and experimentation are our foundational elements, and we specialize in DevSecOps, Big Data, AI/ML, SysOps, and SLA-driven services to support multi-cloud solutions.
Job Profile
Leading sales activities for CloudCover in the APAC market.
Driving all opportunities generated from AWS, Google and Microsoft for their APAC business and working with end customers to move towards closure.
Managing the sales relationship with end customers to drive cross-sell and upsell of CloudCover services through effective account management
Building strong working relationships with Partner Managers, Sales and Marketing teams and Technology Specialists
Work with Partner teams to generate opportunities for CloudCover Consulting and Managed Services
Prospecting and nurturing leads to drive net new business for CloudCover
Be a single point of contact between Microsoft, Amazon & Google end customers and the CloudCover team in your region.
Required Skills
Prior experience in Enterprise Sales and Account Management for customers in APAC.
Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills.
Understanding of Cloud Computing is a must.
Solution and Consultative Selling Mindset.
Strong communication skills
Preferred Skills
Experience with any Cloud Platform, preferably AWS (or GCP, Azure etc)
Partnership or Sell Through Experience.
BTech/BE
Opportunities in the Role
Gain strong working knowledge exposure to latest technologies: AWS, Azure, GCP
Work with a fast growing Cloud Consulting company expanding into new geographies
Opportunity to contribute own ideas and opinions with senior management
A fast career growth path within a fast track industry.

company: Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Amazon Web Services  Customer Success  Management Skills  Leadership  Architectural  Channel  Selling  Marketing  Sales Process  Strategy  Business Development  vars  Brand Awareness
job_description:
Would you like to help large Enterprise companies across Asia accelerate and maximise their success using the cloud and a global channel ecosystem Do you have a track record of successfully defining and executing channel orientated go-to-market (GTM) strategies and partner-led sales campaigns for Enterprise customers Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in cloud computing and we are looking for a strategic and dynamic results-oriented candidate to join as the Asia Pacific & Japan Partner Co-sell Lead for the Enterprise market.
In this role, you will have an exciting opportunity to shape Asia's regional strategy to help Enterprise customers adopt and transform using cloud solutions through the amazing AWS Partner Network. Your role is to define, develop and lead the delivery of strategic GTM initiatives through the AWS Partner Network for the Enterprise sector to accelerate customers cloud adoption. Your responsibilities will include developing the Enterprise customer segment strategy focused on leveraging the AWS Partner Network to drive customer success metrics, planning, business development and developing/maturing cross-functional go-to-market execution mechanisms to accelerate customer outcomes and innovations. You will collaborate with global, cross-functional teams including AWS sales, business development, marketing, and technical field professionals to determine how to best accelerate growth and success in the Enterprise customer segment through collaborative selling (co-sell) with the AWS Partners and monitoring progress against the business plan, this includes working closely with AWS Partners like Global/National System Integrators and Independent Software Vendors. You will use market and data signals to drive the Enterprise Co-sell strategy to most effectively serve AWS Enterprise customer engagements that are led or supported by AWS Partner Network. This strategy outlines the most effective co-sell initiatives to accelerate the growth and success in the customer segment and monitoring progress against key co-sell initiatives. Through partnership with AWS Sales leaders and the AWS Partner Network you will define and drive field education to ensure AWS sales teams and AWS Partner Network can effectively co-sell to accelerate customer success.
The right candidate will have experience interacting at the highest levels of Enterprise companies and demonstrated experience in developing business development and go-to-market initiatives. They will have a proven record of leading and driving multiple strategic initiatives, across a region like Asia, to meet business objectives, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data/metrics bias, excellent initiative/program management skills and a passion for helping Enterprise companies get started using cloud to achieve business goals. They will have knowledge of cloud messaging, positioning, and strong experience in solution sales, marketing and field enablement.
Key job responsibilities
Develop and mature mechanisms to deeply understand needs, gaps, and opportunities with the Asia Pacific and Japan AWS Enterprise customer market and the AWS Partner Network.
Lead annual channel sales and GTM planning for the Asia Pacific and Japan Enterprise customer segment.
Define, develop and lead the delivery of regional partner GTM and sales campaign initiatives for the Enterprise customer segment to accelerate customer outcomes. This includes incubating new strategic initiatives.
Develop data driven narrative strategies and proposals for new initiatives, or evolving/retiring existing initiatives/programs.
Develop and mature measurement and monitoring mechanisms for the business plan (including customer success metrics capture) and analytics for identifying signals, opportunities, and challenges.
Collaborate with AWS sales leaders and the AWS Partner Network to develop field education programs to enable both AWS sales and the AWS Partner Network help Enterprise customers to maximise their business success using cloud technologies.
10+ years of experience in business development, sales, marketing, advisory, and/or strategy roles. 5+ years of experience in the Enterprise customer segment.

job_description:
Opportunity to be a part of the IT Service Delivery and Management (Cloud Computing) organization in Singapore!
Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on The Straits Times and Statista's list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021).
Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years.
Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.
Position Description:
The Cloud Computing team develops the strategy and works with teams worldwide to govern, grow, and operate Cloud solutions. Our team embraces the regulatory challenges of our industry and drives innovative, secure, and compliant use of Cloud Service Providers. We collaborate closely with internal and external partners worldwide to mature our ability to utilize Cloud Service Providers. Our team also impacts application development agility worldwide via our cloud-based application hosting Platform as a Service (PaaS).
Candidate will provide engineering and operational support to teams leveraging the cloud platforms and automate routine tasks, focusing on cloud FinOps.
Essential duties and responsibilities:
As part of a global team responsible for maintaining and operating production cloud services
Improve services reliability by writing, testing and maintaining automation code for operational tasks, focusing on cloud cost optimization.
Troubleshooting, debugging, identifying root cause, documenting problems and implementing preventive measures.
Interact with both Business and Technical teams throughout the various organizations
Use extensive knowledge of APIs to perform integration with existing data providers
Leverage analytics for cost optimization opportunities
Interact with both Business and Technical teams throughout the various organizations for project consulting, design reviews, and technical guidance
Market cloud services throughout the organization to help drive meaningful adoption
WHAT YOU MUST HAVE
To be successful in this role, you will have:
Education Minimum Requirement:
MSc Degree or BSc Degree or equivalent with relevant experience in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
Required Experience and Skills:
Must Have:
At least 2 years of working knowledge of public cloud hosting services such as Amazon Web Services and/or Azure preferred.
Fluent in scripting languages like Ruby, Python and Java (preferred).
Must be able to develop and update light-weight applications, scripts, and services
Working knowledge of utilizing analytics software.
Must have experience writing and understanding Technical Documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Good problem solving & analytical skills.
Ability to work in a distributed team.
Self-starter & self-motivated individual.
Having AWS cloud certification is desirable.
Good to have:
Knowledge of containerization software such as Docker.
Knowledge of servers, networking, monitoring, patching and security best practices.
FinOps knowledge.
Our Support Functions deliver services and makes recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the experience of working at our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.
WHO WE ARE
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us and start making your impact today.

tech_stack: Cloud solutions  Cloud Applications  Cloud Computing  Amazon Aws  AWS  Information Technology  Solution Architecture  Cloud  Aws Lambda  Professional Services  Amazon Cloud  Architect  Project Management  Architecture Design
job_description:
The Team
The unique business relationship between Accenture and AWS allows us to bring our clients deep technical expertise, extensive AWS experience and breakthrough innovations. We offer solutions across 16+ industries, helping our clients outmaneuver uncertainty and drive enduring business growth at speed and scale with a cloud first strategy to achieve the full value of cloud, end-to-end. As a team, we are empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community of experts that giving us opportunities to deepen our technical skills.
The Role
Design Cloud Native Application Architectures or optimize applications for AWS.
Deliver architecture guidance, lead projects, conduct customer workshops and implement complex data analytics workloads with our customers and partners.
Business Case development/TCO, application assessment, and migration planning, Cloud Operating Model design
Provide solutions to complex business problems for area(s) of responsibility where analysis of situations requires an in-depth knowledge of organizational objectives.
Helping customers become more data driven to achieve their business goals
Contribute to the Accenture AWS community and assets
The Right Profile
Minimum 5 years of proven experience handling large scale project implementations using AWS services such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), Amazon Elastic Map Reduce (EMR), Amazon SageMaker (development of advanced analytics and Machine Learning pipelines), AWS Glue (serverless Apache Spark workloads), AWS Lambda (serverless computing) in a distributed environment with large data pipelines using technologies such as Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc.
Specialization in at least two of the following areas: Data: Databases (SQL/NoSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, MariaDB, PostgreSQL), Big Data open source tools (Hadoop, Spark), Big Data proprietary tools (Hortonworks, Cloudera) programing experience (Java, Python, R, Julia, SQL) BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, Microstrategy, Cognos, etc).
Cloud Native Application Architecture: AWS PaaS/FaaS services, Serverless architecture, Lambda, API Gateway, Containerization and Microservices, Lightweight architectures including JavaScript frameworks (Backbone.js, AngularJS, React), single page applications, and modern web applications.
AWS Migration: Optimization of applications to scalable cloud designs, rearchitecting applications to modern cloud patterns, and database migration (including cross-platform)
Enterprise packaged/COTS Applications on AWS: SAP / HANA, Oracle Applications, WebMethods, etc. on AWS.
DevOps and Infrastructure as Code: AWS environment and application automation utilizing CloudFormation and third-party tools (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, etc.). CI/CD pipeline setup using AWS services such as CodeBuild/Commit/Deploy
About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services all powered by the world's largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 570,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

tech_stack: Information Security  Technical Documentation  Vulnerability Scanning  Azure  Cloud Computing  Iam  AWS  Idm  Data Governance  Networking  Python  Gcp  Firewalls  Assurance  Compliance  Audits  Consulting  Regulatory Requirements  Cissp
job_description:
Reporting to the Director, Information Security Engineering, the Senior Information Security Engineer is responsible for successfully executing enterprise-wide Information Security controls and processes that protect the company's data and functions across all business areas, adhering to data protection standards, procedures, regulatory oversight, and technical solutions for the Information Security department. Support of program control processes to ensure mitigation of risks and approved configuration certification of systems. This position requires extensive experience, knowledge, and skills in the areas of cloud-based engineering and design.
Supporting established processes, analysis of computing environment, coordination, testing, CICD workflow, IAM, and participation in periodic audits. Performs all duties in accordance with the company's policies and procedures, all state, federal, and country laws and regulations, wherein the company operates. Delivery of activity reporting, including metrics, environment impact, effectiveness progress, and performance indicators.

Duties & Responsibilities
Assists in the execution of the Information Security Program, Data Governance practices, and Privacy assurance
Evaluates ongoing practices and procedures, technical documentation, and diagrams for appropriate security measure maturity and effectiveness
Coordinates with team members and other technical departments for project activities, to ensure completion of assigned project requirements
Monitors effective and actionable Information Security reporting across the InfoSec technical landscape and ensure anomalies are identified for preventive or responsive measures
Executes as a reliable second line-of-defense via documented processes, controls, templates, and rigors
Practices applicable procedures and standards that meet existing and newly developed policy and regulatory requirements (i.e., PCI-DSS, SOX, GDPR, CCPA, etc.)
Provides consulting on best practices to internal customers to ensure processes are embedded at the correct time and frequency and to ensure compliance to security standards
Evaluates existing tool effectiveness, and provides feedback for continuous improvement to the security controls in place to enhance the company's security posture

job_description:
Would you like to engage directly with C-level executives, IT professionals and influencers at all levels to help assess and understand the business value, ROI and financial benefits of running workloads on AWS Can you take complex IT workloads and cost models scenarios and simplify them down to the essentials that are easy for sales managers and reps to understand and apply Are you good at defining and quantifying business value, benefits and migration costs of improved processes and tooling Do you have the business savvy and the technical background necessary to help establish Amazon in ASEAN as a key technology platform provider AWS is leading the next paradigm shift in information technology and is looking for world-class candidates to join its Migration Team & Enterprise in ASEAN
AWS is looking for a Cloud Economics Business Development Manager, who will help prospective customers in ASEAN shape their information technology strategies and financial models, and quantify the benefits of running applications in the cloud. You will play a key role in accelerating the Cloud migration journey for these customers. You will identify economic barriers to adoption of AWS Cloud with these customers and develop repeatable strategies to overcome these barriers. You will communicate the economic value proposition for AWS cloud to a broad audience of IT, business & senior financial customer executives (CFO level). You will work with partners and other groups within AWS to give customers the best insights into how to run their applications on AWS cloud, in the most cost effective manner. You will also be expected to be the focal point within AWS for all business development activities.
The ideal candidate will possess a business background, with a strong understanding of sales operations and financial processes, combined with the technical depth, business experience and financial understanding to easily communicate the economic benefits of cloud computing. Familiarity with complex legacy IT environments, quantifying and developing business cases to justify large scale technology investments and creating detailed cost models for these environments is preferred.
Your responsibilities will include driving business case, value analysis and ROI related BD activities within AWS as well as supporting the ASEAN Sales organization, Marketing, BD and Partner teams on ROI/economic related customer and partner engagements. You will serve as an expert resource on the financial modeling of IT applications and infrastructures. You will engage directly with our customer's CFOs and their organization to understand the impact of cloud on the business case and funding decisions. In appropriate cases you will bring in other AWS resources as necessary to help our customers properly evaluate their IT options from an economic perspective.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as a key member of the Business Development team in helping to drive AWS Sales engagements with our customers regarding the economics of their IT infrastructure.
Work with AWS Sales, Solutions Architects and BD teams to drive proactive business value and financial conversations with our customers
Serve as a central resource for the ASEAN Sales team to help our customers create appropriately detailed financial models for their current and future IT landscape.
Serve as a key source of market insights into how our customers view the economic benefit of using AWS relative to deploying applications on-premise or in traditional data centers
Create a repository of cloud economics cases studies to share learnings and benchmark data within the AWS team and with our partners
In conjunction with Training, help create cloud economics related training programs and material for the ASEAN team, AWS partners, and AWS customers themselves so that they can properly address TCO and economic-related issues
Work with internal stakeholders to communicate market realities regarding the economics of running IT applications and infrastructures in the cloud
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
7 years of business development, IT operations, management consulting, financial advisory or experience.
Detailed business case development, financial modeling and analysis of large scale technology investments
Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations, including sales, marketing, business development and training.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively and deliver results across cross-functional, remote and virtual teams
A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must this is a hands-on role
PREFERRED
Prior experience working with senior executives (both IT and Finance), IT outsourcing vendors and cloud service providers to analyze implementation options for on-premise, remote virtualized and cloud IT Infrastructure
Prior experience working in the IT industry is highly desired, either as a vendor, consultant or as an enterprise customer.
Some relevant technical knowledge is helpful, such as: enterprise systems, database systems, core distributed computing concepts, fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, etc. with ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between varied cloud computing services.

Work closely with the Regional SE Director, Product Management, Technical Marketing, and R&D team, while sharing feedback from the field and promoting new technical requirements (RFEs).
Provide design consultation and best practice guidance.
Champion the Customer Engagement Practice to develop deep technical account coverage across the region.
Work closely with the regional cybersecurity specialist and support in demonstration, proof of value and proof of concept that showcase our value argumentations.
Work closely with regional cybersecurity specialist to demos for strategic prospects and current accounts in all facets of Fortinet's security fabric.
Help develop relationships with technology alliances, partners who will be critical to winning over new top-tier customers.
Requirements:
In-depth knowledge of various enterprise security and networking solution, experience that emphasizes L2-L4 Networking, Network Security, Virtualization and Cloud Computing.
Experience in Software Define Networking, Network Firewall virtualization and Orchestration.
Good understanding of Infrastructure automation (like Puppet, Chef, Ansible) Orchestration (Kubernetes, Mesos, Swarm) and Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Openstack).
Experience in API scripting, security strategies for container and micro service platform.
Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, Anti-Virus, Advance Threat Prevention, Web Application Firewall, Distributed Denied of Services, Application Delivery Controller, and Mail security.
Strong understanding in concepts of mitigating attack vectors and defense in depth.
Strong knowledge on upcoming security and networking trends and ability to stitch Fortinet suite of products into a turnkey solution.
Good understanding on encryption and authentication concepts.
Good understanding on virtualization and service chaining.
Strong advocate of consultative-based approach in solutioning and selling.
Good team player and highly motivated individual with strong problem solver mentality.
Experience in Private Cloud such as Cisco ACI, VMWARE NSX, Openstack and demonstrable experience in securing these environments.
BSCS or equivalent and 8+ years of experience as an SE or systems integrator
Preferably with achievement on CCNP, CISSP, GIAC, FCNSP NSE, AWS CSA or MCSE
Willing to travel across the region frequently.

This group will be a part of a large Cloud Engineering Operations team that is currently involved inbuilding, operating and managing cloud infrastructure for Seagate and potential external customers. About the role- you will:
Work collaboratively with colleagues based in the US, Singapore and Malaysia to provide 24 x 7 cloud operations support
Work extensively with third-party contractors working in shifts to monitor and maintain service uptime
Get on troubleshooting incidents calls to restore service when needed
Track and maintain Service Level Objectives and Error Budget. Create operational dashboards, reports and other visual and quantitative management tools to track and report on network and system uptime, service interruptions, and other service level metrics
Shift: Morning Shift (7am to 7pm)
Maintain constant vigilance and situational awareness of all incidents, escalations and events related to maintaining service uptime
Work closely with the Cloud Development & Infrastructure Engineering team and Customer Support team.
Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
About you:
Exposure to ITIL based service management, including implementing ITIL based control processes
Proven record of accomplishment managing IT service delivery in complex, mission-critical environment
Good verbal and written communication skills
Good analytical skills
Well versed in the working with onsite/offshore and core team/flex team models
Familiar with DevOps, Continuous Integration & Delivery and Release on demand concepts
Used industry standards monitoring and logging tools like Zabbix, Prometheus and Fluentd
Familiarity with hardware load balancers, proxies, and firewalls
Familiarity with cluster management in Kubernetes or any other Cloud native environment
Knowledge of PowerShell, Bash, Perl or Python for scripting and automation
Linux scripting and Administration. Linux based deployment using Command Line Interface
Familiarity with Kubernetes and Kubernetes native applications
Familiarity with 100 Gbps network topology
Your experience includes:
Data Center Operations technical support
Production support of the main services offered to customers, troubleshooting outages and incidents, capacity planning, working closely with the customer support and development engineering team
Worked with cloud native apps and systems in an on-prem or private cloud environment
Kubernetes and Kubernetes native applications
Used NGINX and/or NGINX Plus
Complex network topologies and 100 Gbps networks
Used ITIL based ITSM tool, creation of SOPs, and problem triage
S3 or any other object storage highly desirable
Linux scripting and Administration. Linux based deployment using Command Line Interface
100 Gbps network topology
Jira and GitLab

In response to COVID-19, this position may temporarily begin and be performed remotely. Seagate is actively evaluating the virus and our employees health and safety are our top priority. In the future, this position will report to and be performed at our Shugart location.

The Team
Our cybersecurity team offer services that enable mission resilience by offering deep cyber expertise, advanced analytics, continuous monitoring, and secure cloud services. Working closely with our clients, we design, build and implement information security strategies and solutions that can help enhance business performance.
The Role
Work closely with the product teams to understand our products in depth to document the product details including the security architecture, attack surface, trust boundaries and data flows.
Assist in develop Threat Models that enumerate cybersecurity threats by attack surface. Document and verify the existing security mitigations and identify if additional mitigations are required for our products.
Lead the documentation of product cybersecurity requirements, cybersecurity risk analysis, verification and validation protocols.
Work with the product teams to define security mitigations, provide guidance during mitigation development.

In-depth knowledge of security concepts regarding web, iOS, Android and Rest API security. Understanding of current and emerging security technologies and threats.
Proficient with methodologies, tools, best practices and processes across various cybersecurity areas.
Proven experience with threat modelling and risk analysis.
Ability to gather written and verbal information from multiple sources, assess and consolidate risks to provide appropriate recommendations.
Hands-on experience with penetration testing and vulnerability analysis frameworks and tools.
Experience in developing test routines and protocols to validate security mitigations.
About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations servicesall powered by the world's largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Global Account Management  Account Management  Forecasting  Telecommunication Industry  Strategy  Telecommunication  Apac  Cadence  Stakeholder Management  strategic partnerships
job_description:
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 500,000 Enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and cloud technologies, VMware simplifies complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, and the network, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace. Our team of 34,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back.
Communications Service Providers are adopting virtualization and cloud technologies to transform the delivery of their services and become providers of rich 5G, Edge, and IoT offerings. As the pioneers of virtualization and cloud technologies, honed over 20 years of delivering best in class solutions to the our worldwide customer base, VMware is well placed to be a leading vendor of Telco Cloud solutions for network and IT transformation in CSP environments, and already commands a leading market share in this segment.
The VMware Global Account Program serves approximately 100 of VMware's largest customers. These premier accounts are managed by a team of experienced Global Account Executives, with the objective to establish a significant VMWare footprint in the largest and most influential corporations worldwide. Our selling is focused on our customers primary business initiatives and connecting our value to our customers business value. Our Value Selling strategy is the investment of time, talent and technology from VMware and our partners to invent (transform) our customers business for their benefit. This strategic objective is being accomplished using highly focused and experienced account management, marketing, and engineering teams, as well as substantial executive level engagement.
Role Brief:
Reporting to the APAC Telco Head, and a key part of the Global Telco Sales vertical, this Global Account Director role will be dedicated to a single telco account and will have principle responsibility for the Singtel Group worldwide. This business leader will own the overall account strategy and management including the creation and execution of a business-outcome based strategic account plan, goal obtainment, and revenue growth. This will be achieved by leading a matrix management of sales, specialist, and partner resources, to ensure value-added benefits and deeper plus wider reach into the customer. The Global Account Director will serve as the executive contact across the customer on behalf of VMware, communicating VMware's unique value. They must maintain a peer-level relationship and trusted advisor status at the C-suite level of their customer.
Role Responsibilities:
Responsible for the master strategy for the global strategic account and ensures the strategy is executed
Oversees and implements business case and value selling strategies which align the customer's needs (up to the C-Suite/Board), to VMware solutions and services
Manages tactical business while investing in larger, longer term strategic opportunities
Constructs and sells large multi-product, integrated solutions and services utilizing strategic partnerships which drive business outcomes
Maintains high touch and trusted advisor status with the customer
Delivers operational excellence in the day to day running of the account, through owning the accurate forecasting of the Singtel business globally, opportunity management and pipeline build, and representing the Singtel account on sales cadence calls
Act as an inspired leader and sales coach for a large extended team of virtual resources, to ensure consistent and effective team engagement and ensuring optimal usage of resources across management, supporting and partner organizations
Required Skills and Experience:
At least 10-15 years of experience in technology sales, including software / SaaS
Previous experience in regional sales roles across multiple geographies and time zones
At least 10 years of experience selling to Service Providers with meaningful relationships towards a range of key decision makers across the customer organization
Proven sales leadership in a global software organization with matrixed sales management responsibility, experienced in driving and closing large complex deals
Sales of Service Provider related technologies and offerings including 5G, Core, RAN, Edge, IoT, SD-WAN, SDN, SASE, Security, Orchestration, Assurance, etc.
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Our team looks for candidates who embody our EPIC2 values - Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers and Community. Team members who are logically curious, interpersonal, customer focused and able to find the humour in situations tend to thrive at VMware.
A history of selling to Singtel in Singapore, and its affiliates internationally
Established and referencable relationships with key customer contacts
An understanding of, or experience with, VMware technologies
Familiar with Target Account Selling or another established sales methodology
Highly trusted individual who maintains and expects high standards for self and team
Self-starter with a high level of commitment and energy

tech_stack: Php  Cloud Computing  HTML  Kotlin  Open Source  Ruby  Software Design  Gcp  C#  video games  Construction  Dynamics  value creation  facebook  Rust
job_description:
Our team, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, is looking for impact-focused, entrepreneurial engineers ready to bring their ideas and make a difference. We apply our engineering skills and business savvy to solve challenges at the intersection of business and innovation in many of today's most exciting industries and products. These include Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Games, Workplace, AI and many more.

We are engineers, and we write scalable, high performance code across Meta's products to ship new solutions that address partners opportunities and challenges. We also design and deliver technical solutions critical to our partners success. In doing so, we help partners realize the full value of working with the Meta family of apps focusing on helping them grow their business with us while reducing the effort and investment to leverage our platforms.

As a Partner Engineer, you will get the opportunity to see the business impact of the solutions you build with our partners. You will get to learn and build on different tech stacks and languages. You will use your entrepreneurial passion and the freedom that the role provides to create your own opportunities and choose how you make an impact. In short, it's like being the engineering lead in a startup.

Partner Engineer: This role includes a combination of partner-facing time to understand their technical and business needs and then code solutions to address those needs. That coding output can be in the form of APIs, product integrations or tools to help partners and Meta achieve mutually beneficial outcomes.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Deeply understand Meta apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation
Deeply understand Meta apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Guide workflow changes, and gain consensus from stakeholders while driving toward solutions
Respond and maintain effective communication with industry partners and internal stakeholders
Work with partners to develop a long- term strategic plan, grounded on business objectives, and manage partners during integrations with Meta's platform products and ensure value creation
Represent Meta and our products, APIs and tools in partner meetings and industry events including F8
Understand organisational structure and cross functional team dynamics and is able to get support from those teams as needed
Build and manage strong working relationships with technical counterparts. Mentor and share knowledge with peers, creating positive atmosphere amongst team
Willingness to travel approximately 20% of the time
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of experience as a software engineer building and shipping products or equivalent experience
Experience with open source languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin, Rust, Go or C#
Knowledge of the Web technology stack (for example HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS) on front and backend
Experience with software design and architecture
Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Write and ship reliable, scalable, and efficient code
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Client/partner-facing and/or experience communicating to an audience is preferred
Experience with REST APIs, developer platforms and SDKs
Experience working on multi-person code bases including open source or personal projects
Experience with open source contributions (especially as part of larger projects)
Experience contributing to developer and platform documentation
Experience working with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience working in Android codebases.
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible todaybeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.
