job_description:
Job Description
Sprinklr is looking for an experienced security analyst with 5 years of work experience within the cyber security domain. You will work with key stakeholders across Sprinklr i.e. sales, success, legal and compliance teams to assist with cyber security, data privacy and compliance needs. Headquartered in New York City, with a development team based in India, you will be expected to work across time zones to drive a cohesive, world-class security operation.
Job Requirements
Respond to security RFPs and assessments in a timely manner.
Review security terms and collaborate with the legal team for contract execution.
Deliver security presentations to customers and upper management.
Evaluate security solutions to ensure they meet security requirements for processing classified information.
Perform risk assessment, customer on site audits and analysis to support certification and accreditation.
Prepare and review documentation to include system security plans, risk assessment reports, certification and accreditation packages.
Work with the security team and others in technology management to document priorities and structure project team activities to align with those priorities.
Maintain timely and proactive communication with management and other parties.
Prepare and present status reports, results, and presentations as required.
Develop an understanding of key company business processes and success drivers.
Maintain a solid understanding of cybersecurity principles and concepts.
Experience with compliance frameworks such as SSAE 18; PCI-DSS; ISO 27001; NIST, GDPR etc.
Skills & Competencies
3-5 years of experience within the cyber security domain in a high-tech/SaaS high-growth environment
Excellent verbal and written communications skills; comfortable to present to business and technical leadership at all levels
Experience with responding to customer RFPs/RFIs and questionnaires with efficiency and accuracy.
Knowledge of security certifications such as SOC, ISO27001, FedRAMP, PCI etc.
Experience with creating and maintaining security policies and procedures
Knowledgeable with cloud computing and cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure and GCP
Experience working with multiple time zones especially the US and India
Knowledge of OWASP and NIST is preferred
Any security accreditations such as CISSP, CompTIA+ would be good to have
Lastly but most importantly, you are methodical, detail oriented and a great teammate

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services, Inc. (AWS) enables customers of all s to run their applications on Amazon's industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform. This growth is driving the need for an experienced Business Insights Analyst. Amazon has a strong culture of data-driven decision-making requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We are looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who is passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making.

In this role, the Business Insights Analyst serves as the subject matter expert to fulfil data-driven decision making demands. As the successful candidate, you must be able to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large and complex datasets. You will continuously evolve business reporting, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting and analytical tools, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity.

You will be passionate about your work, detail-oriented, analytical, and possess creative problem-solving abilities. You will need to demonstrate subject matter expertise in querying and extracting large datasets and the accompanying tools and programming languages needed to work with them. You will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights both verbally and in writing in a clear and precise manner.

Main responsibilities as follows.

1) Lead the development of self-service reporting and analysis by creating and owning business reports and insight products
2) Conduct data analysis to solve business problems through the use of statistical and/or machine learning models
3) Continuously sharpen the skillset by learning and maintaining knowledge of existing and emerging reporting/analytical tools
4) Collaborate with the internal and global data engineering teams on the design, development and maintenance of data infrastructure including data models
5) Collaborate with the internal and worldwide data science teams on the design, development and maintenance of statistical and/or artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

1) Bachelor's degree with emphasis on statistical and analytical skills
2) Proficiency in relational databases (Redshift, RDS, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and SQL for querying and extracting data
3) Proficiency in at least programming languages (Python, Java, R, etc.) for data gathering, data cleansing and statistical analysis
4) Expertise in data visualisation software (QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.) for effective data presentation
5) Creative and analytical thinking to generate interesting approaches to answering business questions
6) Effectively use data to make strategic business decisions and generate next best actions
7) Strong and effective written and oral communication to clearly convey data findings
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

1) 5+ years of work experience as a Business Analyst
2) Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial
3) Proficiency in different types of databases (relational vs. non-relational, etc.) and their relevant use cases
4) Experience working with Cloud Computing
5) Experience in agile product management
6) Experience in deploying artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models into production
7) AWS certified (AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate, AWS Certified Data Analytics, etc.)

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects using the newest technology Would you like to gain the deepest customer and partner insights on maximizing the value of cloud computing technologies

At AWS, we're hiring highly technical Cloud Consulting Consultants to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, AI/ML & DevOps transformations.
. Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field business development, marketing, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), Amazon Simple DB/RDS databases, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), etc.
. Solutions - Define and deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in on-site visits with prospective customers, understanding customer requirements, and proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements.
. Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services.
. Insights - Work with AWS engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services.
Basic Qualifications :
. Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
. Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
. Highly technical and analytical, possessing 7 or more years of IT implementation experience
. Deep hands-on experience leading the design, development and deployment of business software at scale
. Experience with agile approaches and Experience in DevOps or DevSecOps
. Proven experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies required
. Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. security, privacy, SOX, HIPPA etc.)
. Current hands-on software development experience required Internet-related business models preferred
. Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations
. BS level technical degree required Computer Science or Math background preferred
Preferred Qualifications :
.
. Strong track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing environments. Integration of AWS cloud services with on-premise technologies from Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc.
. Masters degree in Computer Science

job_description:
Meet Our Team:
The 1:1 Customer Engagement Business Unit has the mission of accelerating Pega's growth and scaling our business in relation to RTIM (Real-Time Interaction Management) - delivering Customer Value Optimization to our clients. As a 1:1 sales specialist, you will report directly into the 1:1 Specialist Sales organization but enjoy close links with the local account team / sales leadership.
Picture Yourself at Pega:
You will have access to Pega's market-leading solutions, uncapped earning potential and the world's most innovative organizations as reference-able clients. You will be a thought leader, a true partner and a collaborator with clients seeking to rethink the way they run their business.
What You'll Do at Pega:
Penetrate new organizations/accounts or radiate within the existing customer base for 1:1 Customer Engagement opportunities and to meet or exceed defined booking targets.
Leverage the challenger selling principles for 1:1 Customer Engagement by providing insight to the customer as the basis of the commercial conversation, teaching customers something new/valuable about how to compete in their market
Through training, become deeply conversant in Pegasystems value propositions for 1:1 Customer Engagement and Customer Decisioning, including the technology, differentiators, customer references and solutions to learn how to map solutions to client needs and develop an expertise in Pegasystems 1:1 Customer Engagement advantages.
Work and sell with Partners on 1:1 Customer Engagement opportunities.
Who You Are:
Comfortable dealing with senior executives in marketing, retention, customer experience, (digital) channels, data and analytics, customer value management.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with both senior business and IT managers within large blue-chip organizations.
Comfortable working in an entrepreneurial, high growth and pressurized environment
Able to grasp new technology concepts quickly and think creatively.
Able to communicate and organize up, down and across the organization to get desired outcomes.
What You've Accomplished:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience. 8-10+ years selling complex enterprise software solutions to major organizations and / or equivalent in a marketing services / consultancy / agency environment.
Extensive knowledge of the CMO, Retention Executive, Revenue Officer etc., Next Best Action / Real-TIme Interaction Management, predictive analytics and real-time marketing services and products from an enterprise technology perspective.
Thorough understanding of the Digital Marketing landscape including Paid Media & Social.
Pega Offers You:
Gartner and Forrester Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products
The opportunity to join, contribute to and learn from, the market-leading global team
Continuous learning and development opportunities
An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com, is the industry's leading cloud computing platform. The AWS Startup team is seeking a talented, experienced, self-directed Program Manager to join the ISV team that is responsible for driving adoption of the AWS platform by startups globally.
In this role, you will be responsible for owning and executing key ISV programs across Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ). You will be required to identify, develop and execute regional startup programs for APJ, in collaboration with the ISV and Marketing team. You must be able to directly understand and relate to the startup experience, have an innate understanding for entrepreneurs, company founders and technical decision makers at early stage companies, and be passionate about helping build new ideas for the startup community. Ideally, you are someone that has had experience designing and developing new products targeted at the startup community. You should be familiar and interested in driving innovation in customer facing products, and have a track record of owning successful, metrics driven development plans. You must be able to work with and influence different teams across organizations to work toward a common development goal.
The ideal candidate will have a strong program management background with experience leading medium to large projects. The candidate will also have a business development background with strong ability to earn trust with startup founders, as well as work cross-functionally across the Amazon organization. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.

Key job responsibilities
Work closely with customers, ISV Marketing, and specialist teams across the organization to understand the needs of entrepreneurs and how to help them meet those needs to achieve growth. Research and ideate potential solutions to process gaps and hurdles in the startup experience.
. Develop and execute on new ISV Programs at the country or APJ level.
. Implement customer usage metrics & reporting, with a strong focus on improving customer experience.
. Manage the entire lifecycle of the initiatives you are responsible for, including showing operations success and developing on further iterations.
Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree in any field
. 7-10+ years of program/product management or business development experience.
. Demonstrated understanding and savviness in the startup ecosystem, including common patterns of success for startup customers.
. Proven ability to launch successful, external experiences that are used and loved by customers
. Operational savviness, ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously, keeping focus on execution and delivering results consistently.
. Proven ability to work cooperatively with various internal teams, including business development, operations, sales and customer support
. Demonstrated ability to interact with startup executives to both understand their requirements, and to discuss proposed programs and engagements.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.
. Strong analytical skills, with excellent problem-solving abilities in the face of ambiguity.
. Vision to own and drive programs with long term development horizons.
Preferred Qualifications :
. MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
. Operational experience at a startup, preferably as a founder or in a business, operations or strategy role in the startup ecosystem
. Passionate about technology and with some exposure to AWS platform

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_description:
Julian Grey's client is a HR Tech on a SaaS model focusing on employee well being and streamline the feedback processes.
You will support the deployment for the clients and to work closely with stakeholders (Developer team and Sales team) for product improvement and maintenance.
A day-to-day work life would look like the following:
Liaise with the product team for improvements based on the nature of enquiries and customer-feedback
Assist in setup and onboarding of new customers
Provide first and second level support via inbound calls/chats/emails from our clients
Resolve in a timely manner issues escalated from the team
Implementing customer support processes to enhance customer satisfaction
What you have:
Relevant qualification in Information Technology, Computer Science or related fields
Knowledgeable of html, css, php, sql, Javascript to fix bugs whenever required
Team member with a customer-oriented attitude and a passion for technology
Who you are:
Resourceful and Proactive
Values Teamwork and communication
Work Location: Raffles Place (1 min from mrt). Hybrid working arrangement: WFH + 2 or 3 days in office.
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified, other applications will be updated to our database for future job opportunities.

Julian Grey Corporate Advisory Pte. Ltd. (EA: 19C9568)

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com, is the industry's leading cloud computing platform. The AWS Startup team is seeking a talented, experienced, self-directed Program Manager to join the ISV team that is responsible for driving adoption of the AWS platform by startups globally.
In this role, you will be responsible for owning and executing key ISV programs across Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ). You will be required to identify, develop and execute regional startup programs for APJ, in collaboration with the ISV and Marketing team. You must be able to directly understand and relate to the startup experience, have an innate understanding for entrepreneurs, company founders and technical decision makers at early stage companies, and be passionate about helping build new ideas for the startup community. Ideally, you are someone that has had experience designing and developing new products targeted at the startup community. You should be familiar and interested in driving innovation in customer facing products, and have a track record of owning successful, metrics driven development plans. You must be able to work with and influence different teams across organizations to work toward a common development goal.
The ideal candidate will have a strong program management background with experience leading medium to large projects. The candidate will also have a business development background with strong ability to earn trust with startup founders, as well as work cross-functionally across the Amazon organization. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.

Key job responsibilities
Work closely with customers, ISV Marketing, and specialist teams across the organization to understand the needs of entrepreneurs and how to help them meet those needs to achieve growth. Research and ideate potential solutions to process gaps and hurdles in the startup experience.
. Develop and execute on new ISV Programs at the country or APJ level.
. Implement customer usage metrics & reporting, with a strong focus on improving customer experience.
. Manage the entire lifecycle of the initiatives you are responsible for, including showing operations success and developing on further iterations.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in any field
. 7-10+ years of program/product management or business development experience.
. Demonstrated understanding and savviness in the startup ecosystem, including common patterns of success for startup customers.
. Proven ability to launch successful, external experiences that are used and loved by customers
. Operational savviness, ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously, keeping focus on execution and delivering results consistently.
. Proven ability to work cooperatively with various internal teams, including business development, operations, sales and customer support
. Demonstrated ability to interact with startup executives to both understand their requirements, and to discuss proposed programs and engagements.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.
. Strong analytical skills, with excellent problem-solving abilities in the face of ambiguity.
. Vision to own and drive programs with long term development horizons.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
. Operational experience at a startup, preferably as a founder or in a business, operations or strategy role in the startup ecosystem
. Passionate about technology and with some exposure to AWS platform

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_title: Head of Data Analytics Solutions Architect, APJ
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

AWS is looking for an experienced and motivated technical leader to build and manage a team of technically skilled, customer facing Solutions Architects focusing on Analytics in APJ. You will help develop the industry's best cloud based solutions architects by enabling and coaching them on best practices, specialized solution selling, presentation and speaking skills, as well as how to create and present architectures of widely varying and complexity for our specialized services. Working closely with our engineering teams, you will help enable new capabilities for our customers to develop and deploy workloads on AWS.
In this role, you will need to be technically capable and credible in your own right as well as effective in shaping the customer and solutions focused skills of your team. You must enjoy learning and introducing new technologies in order to help colleagues and customers embrace and adopt new solutions. Furthermore, thought leadership in terms of looking beyond the technology and considering the value technology creates for our customers, and helping to change how technology is viewed are important aspects of the role. You will need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other Specialized Organization teams within AWS such as services teams, field solutions architecture, sales, marketing, partner organizations, business development, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management. You should be passionate about helping companies/partners understand best practices for operating on AWS.

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:
. Enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You will have a passion for educating, training, and enabling cloud solutions experts for a diverse and challenging set of customers
. Have a strong understanding of emerging technology solutions. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a Solutions Architect or similar role and managing a team of Solutions Architects and Solution Architect Managers. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions.

Roles and Responsibilities:
. In partnership with the specialized sales teams, formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives
. Hire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions Architects and Managers
. Coach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
. Step into a Solutions Architect role when required to support our customer base
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community
. Guide and motivate the development of whitepapers, data sheets, and other high-value customer facing guidance and best practices

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree
. Leadership experience in a technical, customer-facing role in the technology industry

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of technical design/implementation /consulting experience in the technology industry
. MBA/Technical Master's Degree
. Commitment to promoting a diverse and inclusive culture where all Amazonians and customers are able to participate fully, and enjoy respect and dignity
. Exceptional people-management skills able to inspire and foster the right behaviors in others through leading by example (Player/Coach)
. Experience working with new product/service development teams
. Experience leading leaders
. Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS
. Achieved Associate and/or Professional AWS certifications
. Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
. Experience deploying large-scale production quality systems
. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, developers, and at large events
. Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
. Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
. Track record of building rapport with senior customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO)
. Motivated self-starter, proactive and action-oriented
. Strategic problem solving and collaboration skills
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrix organization (leveraging multiple functions and teams)
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_title: Principal Business Development Manager, SAP on AWS, ASEAN
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.
AWS and SAP have been collaborating since SAP became a customer in 2008. Together, we have certified AWS to support most SAP solutions, brought purpose built EC2 instances to market to support SAP customer needs, and helped SAP leverage AWS services to power a number of their SaaS and PaaS offerings like Concur, SuccessFactors (for government agencies), HANA Enterprise Cloud (HEC), and SCP. AWS has been supporting SAP workloads for customers longer than any other cloud provider (since 2011), has more customers (5,000+ across all segments) than any other cloud provider, is certified to support the largest public cloud (native) SAP S/4HANA (48TB) and BW/4HANA (100TB) deployments, and has more SAP HANA cloud native certifications than other cloud providers (24 HANA certifications vs. 18 for Azure and 11 for GCP).

The SAP on AWS team engages SAP customers through 3 routes to market (RTM): the AWS field, consulting partners, and SAP. We are seeking an accomplished Business Development (BD) leader to build out a high performing BD team globally. The leader will contribute to the overall performance of the business globally measured by revenue growth, net new customers, and reference wins. The successful candidate will have overachieved throughout their career and built strong, deep relationships with F1000 and/or G2000 organizations. This leader will have a broad role - part market maker, part operator, and part general manager - and will build a strategy focused on winning new customer segments and growing existing customer segments for the long term. As a self-starter willing to operate in a multifaceted way, you should also have experience in market development of cloud infrastructure and/or enterprise applications. The right candidate must possess top of the line leadership skills with the ability to execute on key business initiatives. The role will require working with the overall ecosystem to help secure lighthouse customers for new use cases, build scalable go-to-market programs, and develop strategic partnerships. This is an exciting opportunity to drive the go-to-market definition and execution of AWS's strategy for SAP on AWS globally.

Our BD team drives strategic oversight of the GTM plan, sales plays (Migration, SAP Extend, S4HANA, Innovation), compete content, sales tools to build pipeline, field coordination of new service and feature launches, thought leadership white papers, act as the voice of the customer to the service teams, win lighthouse customers in key industries and geos, and support the field on the rapid close of complex deals.

Your responsibilities will include:
. Contribute to a high-performing BD team
. Deliver speaking engagements, collateral, lighthouse wins, and more
. Plan and allocate for the best use of extended team resources in order to meet your team goals
. Ensure that you are continuously learning and differentiating AWS with and for customers
. Drive strategic SAP workloads to deepen business and technical relationships with customers and partners
. Develop mechanisms to establish new business in target market segments and enable the field organization to drive the day-to-day interactions that identify prospects for long-term business opportunities
. Focus on scaling SAP on AWS, scaling existing AWS services, delivering workload/solution specific domain expertise to the broader field organization, and developing repeatable, packaged solutions to solve customer challenges
. As the voice of the customer, your findings will influence product teams to help them evolve the products and address issues, concerns, and requests from the field
. Analyze and determine key customer insights from business drivers, market trends and customer feedback, and operating metrics

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelors degree
. 7+ years of experience in BD customer facing roles in infrastructure or cloud technology
. Experience leading global, cross-functional, virtual teams to ensure holistic customer engagement and satisfaction across all business units and subsidiaries of a single, multi-national account

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of experience in infrastructure architecture, database architecture, and apps
. International experience managing teams across the APJ
. SAP ecosystem BD experience including architecture, applications, and implementations
. Ability to motivate, encourage and coach others to develop strong BD relationships
. Built and managed a healthy sales pipeline focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration
. Experience working with new product/service development teams and their outbound functions
. Track record of building rapport with senior customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO)
. Motivated self-starter, proactive and action-oriented
. Strategic problem solving and collaboration skills
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrix organization (leveraging multiple functions and teams)
. MBA/Technical Master's Degree

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
I
f you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.
CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY
At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Job summary
AWS Cloud enables customers of all s and industries to run their applications on Amazon's cloud computing infrastructure, and to drive innovation which helps transform their businesses. The APJ SMB (Small-Medium Business) segment team is one of the most exciting, fast moving and diverse customer segments within AWS. Our role is to develop programs and drive initiatives across Sales, Partner and Marketing to support the growth objectives of our SMB customer segment across APJ.

The AWS Program Management team defines, builds, launches, and delivers the programs our global customers use every day. We are looking for an individual with experience in program strategy, roadmap development, prioritization and getting things done. S/he should be a self-starter that thrives in ambiguity with the ability to influence multi-functionally and the willingness to roll up sleeves to operate in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate is someone with a demonstrated history of successfully owning and managing large, complex problems and engaging with cross-functional teams, and numerous stakeholders up to senior levels, directly and through influence.

As a Program Manager for APJ SMB, you'll be expected to focus on envisioning, experimenting, creating and operationalizing programs that will impact the APJ SMB customers at scale. You'll be responsible for anticipating bottlenecks, making tradeoffs, and welcoming an acceptable level of risk to maximize business benefit. You will own the execution and program management of strategic initiatives by collaborating with cross-functional work stream owners and reporting progress, updates, challenges, and solutions to leaders.

If you enjoy creating and managing programs that will have big impact on an organization, this is the role for you.
Basic Qualifications :
. 5-10 years of relevant work experience in program management, business development, consulting, sales strategy / sales operations, or client facing role(s)
. Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Ability to effectively lead and work with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalities
. Operational excellence mind-set with prior experience in execution of projects / programs. Adept at simplifying complexity and developing scalable propositions
. Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insights
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must
Preferred Qualifications :
. Broad understanding of public and hybrid cloud platforms working knowledge of AWS services and their relevance to enterprise and industry workloads
. Passion for SMB markets - deep understanding of how SMBs operate and the characteristics of SMBs in various industries and geographies
. Education - BA or above required additional qualifications in relevant areas highly desired

Job Description :
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, industrial equipment, automotive, aerospace, and others sectors. The rapid pace of innovation is driven by more and better access to computing resources, allowing unprecedented amounts of data to be analyzed in near real time on nearly infinite computational resources. Will the cure for cancer come out of a lab or out of a remote computing cluster Emerging technology like AI/ML, IoT, quantum computing, and autonomous systems are making new discoveries possible every day. Our job is to facilitate and support the innovators making those discoveries.

We are looking for a Senior Specialist, Autonomous Computing to join the Autonomous Computing (AC) go to market team. The AC team enables the at-scale development of autonomous systems that seek to improve productivity, safety, and customer operations in some of the most challenging use-cases. Examples of autonomous systems include mobility (autonomous vehicles, aerial taxis), smart electricity grids (demand response), robotics (situational awareness), supply chain (intelligent inventory management), and Industrial Internet (continuously learning digital twins of industrial equipment), and healthcare (diagnostic imaging, precision medicine, drug discovery).

In this role, you will work closely with customers to understand the requirements and complexities involved in developing their autonomous systems, with a particular emphasis on the use of simulations, machine learning, and/or accelerated computing (GPUs, FPGAs, custom ASICs) technologies. You will help define the next AC workloads to pursue, define go-to-market strategies and lead cross-functional initiatives to expand existing markets, develop adoption programs and identify new opportunities. These activities include sizing the market opportunity, identifying a pipeline of potential customers, working with customers to understand technical requirements for proof-of-concepts, creating content to train the field teams, leading external workshops to drive industry thought-leadership, working with product teams to define new features, and identifying partners or potential acquisitions.

The ideal candidate will have deep-domain expertise in one or more domains such as aviation, automotive, power & utilities, renewable energy, financial services, health care, life sciences, or other industry which benefits from autonomous systems. You have business experience to drive an engagement at the CxO/VP level, and have demonstrated program/product go-to-market expertise that will help you work with customers to identify use-cases that take advantage of the power of AWS storage, compute, networking, big data, machine learning, and IoT technologies. Additionally, the candidate will have demonstrated some level of hands-on experience either developing autonomous systems, creating and running simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, accelerating computing workloads on GPUs (or ASICs), and/or developing accelerators. The candidate has the technical depth to communicate the benefits of simulations to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives, while working backwards from customer requirements to suggest scalable solutions and architectures. The candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and being scrappy is a must.

Roles & Responsibilities
. Serve as a key team member of the Autonomous Computing team to identify, define and prioritize the AWS market segments, customer base, and industry verticals we target to achieve the most impactful outcomes
. Develop strategic go-to-market plans for target markets and ensure it is in line with the AWS strategic direction
. Execute the strategic go-to-market plans while working with key internal stakeholders (e. g. solutions architects, product service teams, sales teams, legal, support, etc.)
. Identify specific prospects/partners to approach while communicating the specific value proposition for their business and use case
. Engage with prospects, partners, cross functional teams, and key customers
. Work with customers to understand their Autonomous Systems workflows and how AWS technologies can enable their use-case
. Identify and promote repeatable use cases and case studies to build AWS internal and external market awareness
. Collaborate with internal teams to understand the technical requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings
. Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of our key markets
. Handle high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market

Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of business development, management consulting, strategic partnerships, enterprise sales, technology development, or program/product management experience
. 2+ years working experience developing and deploying simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, and/or developing accelerators
. Experience building Go-To-Market (GTM) plans that scale across an organization
. Deep knowledge of one or more industries that represent potential autonomous computing use-cases
. Experience interfacing with customers (Enterprise, SMB, and Startups) and solution building ability
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight that drives customer adoption and recommendations to the business
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must. Experience speaking at technology conferences, as well as communicating across the organization from technical staff to VP/CxOs.
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key in a matrix environment
. Business and/or technical degree required

Preferred Qualifications :
. M.S., PhD, MBA or other higher degree in a business or technical field
. Solid negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
. Meticulous attention to detail ability to juggle many tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar
. Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, innovative, and rapidly evolving industry and business organization
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

job_title: Capture/Business Development Team Manager APJ, WWPS Capture, Proposal, and Business Desk
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to influence cloud computing adoption in Asia Pacific Japan (APJ) Public Sector (Government, Education and Non-Profit verticals) Would you like to lead a team focused on increasing awareness and adoption of Amazon Web Services by engaging with worldwide public sector organizations in countries such as Singapore, Japan, India, Australia, Korea, Malaysia, Indonesia and others who are reinventing their IT strategy by adopting cloud computing Do you have the business savvy, public sector industry experience and the technical background necessary to help further establish Amazon as a leading cloud platform provider

As a manager of a specialized business development team called Capture, you would focus on the Public Sector technology markets in APJ to help shape and deliver buying, procurement and contracting strategies for using AWS cloud computing web services (Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon RDS, etc.).

Your broad responsibilities will include managing a team that develops and oversees key bid strategies, shapes and influences solicitations, creates cloud buying mechanisms for governments, support new business development, pricing, teaming, proposal strategies and help with written RFx proposals (e.g. Tenders, RFPs, Framework Contracts) for public sector opportunities. This manager role will work with the AWS account, partner and solution architect teams, and APJ leadership to close strategic business at a rapid rate across the public sector.

The ideal candidate will possess appropriate management/supervisory experience, have prior business development background where she or he has identifying, shaping and responding to RFx opportunities and developing innovative technical solutions preferably in APJ. The candidate will possess industry background that enables them manage a team that develops win strategies and ability to communicate effectively with public sector and commercial technical leaders, architects and business leaders. He/she needs demonstrated ability to think strategically about the mission, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

The candidate must have experience with APJ governments, public sector acquisition guidelines and have experience with government RFx compliance requirements. Serve as a key member of the AWS APJ Public Sector teams supporting business strategy, new business development, identifying and responding to RFx opportunities. Identify, manage and execute the RFx proposal response plans while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, service teams, legal, support, etc.). Develop win themes, technical discriminators, and innovative strategies working with AWS stakeholders specific to RFx opportunities. Understand and navigate government contracting vehicles and procedures. Be a thought leader with respect to program pursuit, proposal responses, win themes, technical discriminators, solutions providers and pricing.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 7+ years of business development and/or sales experience
. 9+ years of IT and or Commercial/ Public Sector proposal capture management experience identify and leading competitive procurement
.
. 7+ years of complex deal management and pre-sales experienc
. 5+ supervisory/management experience
.
. Excellent communicator who can quickly earn the respect of the team and customers
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. MBA or equivalent degree
. Excellent communication and writing skills, and be both technical and analytical
.
. Self-motivated with a great sense of urgency and follow-through
. Must have a good understanding of government procurement and government contract vehicles
. Must have the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
. Acts in accordance with vision, mission, and established goals
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Cloud computing

This position reports to the Technical Head and provides the opportunity to exposure to the emerging cloud computing technology and also hands-on experience in project management.
This position is open for both recent graduates and mid-career individuals (mature and non-mature). Graduates interested in this position should possess a Degree Qualification. Mid-career individuals from any qualification level can apply.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Work hard, have fun and make history with AWS Public Policy, Economic Development team. Every year, AWS invests billions of dollars around the world in the newest cloud computing tools, data center infrastructure, and education for cloud-skilled professions. These investments create jobs and support local businesses. Cloud technology helps businesses and governments reduce computing costs, improve productivity and accelerate innovation.

This role will lead a portfolio of public facing research reports studying the economic impact of AWS investments among countries in the Asia-Pacific region. This research has a potential to produce strong business impact across APAC countries: it will be used by teams in AWS Public Policy and AWS Public Relations to communicate economic benefits of AWS investments to government officials, AWS customers and public. This role is for a someone who is resourceful and analytical, who can operate independently in a complex and changing environment, and who enjoys creative thinking and crafting narratives using diverse economic data.

The ideal candidate would have a strong background in one of the following fields: macroeconomics, international trade, labor economics. A proven track record of independently driving research projects and delivering insightful economics research results is strongly preferred. In addition to economic research skills, success in this role also requires strong project management skills and the ability to coordinate across many internal AWS teams (Public Policy, Public Relations, Finance, Sales, etc.), as well as third party (economic consulting companies, academics).

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Master's degree or higher in economics, public policy or related field
. 5+ years of experience with research and analysis in government, consulting, non-profit organizations, or similar.
. Experience in leading research projects and client communication.
. Experience of working with data using Excel, State or other data analytics software
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Excellent communication skills, ability to communicate economic concepts clearly to non-economists.
. Proven track record in telling impactful economic stories with data.
. Previous economic or development policy research or business consultant/analyst experience, with a focus on understanding the intersection of business and public policy in the technology space.
. Resourcefulness and strong research and analytical skills, including the ability to find new sources of information (e.g., data points) to support policy positions.
. Self-starter with proven track record of successfully working with a wide array of functional groups across organizations and culture.
. Experience owning program strategy, overseeing end-to-end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership.
. Project management experience including the strong ability to break down tasks, simplify roadmaps, establish owners and timelines, and status reporting.
. Experience using data and metrics, and leveraging tools and software, to drive improvements in processes.
. Ability to maintain highest personal levels of ethical conduct, confidentiality, and integrity.
. Ability to navigate ambiguous environments.

Here at Amazon -
. We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion.
. Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment.
. Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. AWS elastic compute (EC2) platform is at the core of what most AWS customers are using today to change their business models and solve complex business challenges.

AWS is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) to drive the AWS Graviton business and Go-To- Market (GTM) strategy. Graviton is a highly strategic initiative for AWS, as developing our own silicon in-house provides AWS with additional flexibility to deliver new instances at a faster cadence, providing customers with more choice, targeted performance, and cost optimizations as their workloads continue to evolve. The BDM will be responsible for defining, building, and deploying effective and targeted programs to accelerate broad based sales and business development activities for Graviton instances. The BDM will facilitate the enablement of business development, sales and solution architecture with specific customer centric value propositions and will directly interface with product management and development teams regarding customer and partner requirements. The BDM will synthe data and information gathered from these engagements into succinct findings, derive strategic insights, and persuasively communicate findings and perspectives to product and sales teams, including senior management.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and IT background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels of large Enterprises and Enterprise partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of AWS compute resources, platforms and frameworks in the AWS cloud to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, Enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, business operations, and has a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to Enterprises and Enterprise Partners.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Defines, builds and deploys enterprise focused sales and business development campaigns around the AWS Core EC2 offerings
. Engages, supports and scales business development and sales teams across AWS to be capable of delivering the EC2 value proposition to enterprise customers and partners
. Engages and drives scale at engaging enterprise customers and partners about the AWS EC2 value proposition
. Exhibits proactive ability and expertise in setting customer discussions via AWS sales and partner teams
. Exhibits expertise and drives field and partner readiness for enterprise customers
. Engages in senior level customer meetings to discuss customer's business issues and explores how the AWS EC2 platform can help address and resolve these issues
. Serves as an evangelist for the AWS EC2 platform within AWS, and externally
. Develops a standard market intelligence framework and dynamic analytic model to be utilized by the AWS Sales, Business Development and marketing teams
. Brings the various stakeholders together to help build collective mindshare in augmenting the service
. Establishes ways to measure and track metrics related to adoption of the AWS EC2 instances and services, and to make improvements to the approach based on those measurements
. Prepares and gives business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and metrics.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of experience with cloud computing technologies at scale and engaging with customers from start-ups to large fortune 100 enterprises
. Experience with cloud computing and or related fields (IT, software, etc.) - Experience with CPUs and Enterprise servers
. Solid enterprise negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Good understanding of ARM CPU Architecture & software ecosystem
. Experience with data center implementations

job_title: Network Deployment Manager, Global Network Build
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon's network is a key differentiator for Amazon Cloud Computing and Web Services (AWS), enabling the global operation of thousands of applications across a highly complex global infrastructure. The AWS Networking team develops and operates the network platform for all of Amazon including e-commerce products and cloud computing solutions. This platform is industry-leading for its efficiency, throughput and reliability, and it is critical to the success of hundreds of thousands of AWS customers.

Are you ready to own the end-to-end Infrastructure Delivery for the largest cloud network on the planet The Infrastructure Delivery Network Deployment Team (IDND) is responsible for structured cabling, hardware deployment, and hardware commissioning related to network deployment during the initial phase of a data center. The Manager is responsible for a medium, geographically diverse team of highly qualified network engineers. This leader will be responsible for end-to-end delivery of our Network Infrastructure, including Safety, Scheduling, Standards and Implementation for new builds across the APAC Region. This leader is expected to significantly enhance our speed, quality, and safety in deploying new capacity to our network in Data Center sites across the region. You will ensure the right resources/structure is in place to proactively stay ahead of our capacity demands while applying common sense around capital efficiency. Our leaders are deeply technical, understanding their environment to accurately represent issues and implement a strategy that continues to set new records for cycle time, quality and staff efficiency.

In this role, you will manage resources responsible for configuring and deploying all network infrastructure in new AWS data centers. This leader will drive the strategy to innovate and optimize our new scale deployment while instilling the highest level of operational excellence in tools and processes. The mission of the team is to deliver network capacity on time with zero rework. The manager will be responsible for a full-time team of technicians and Fly-In/Fly-Out remote support technicians whilst they are in region supporting build efforts.

This leader will be integral to the wider infrastructure management senior leadership team, collaborating with our engineering and operations teams on new solutions and designs. They will own all aspects of people management.

Our engineers, managers, and leaders are innovators at heart come join us and become integral to the technology company that is the past, present and future of real Cloud Computing.
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
. 3+ years of experience in a data center technology role
. 5+ years of experience in management/team lead function
. 3 + years of TCP/IP networking knowledge
. 3 + years of knowledge of network cabling, optic types, and test equipment
Preferred Qualifications :
. 6+ years in a data center technology role
. Experience with building physical data center such as copper/fiber cabling
. Experience developing operational metrics to drive efficiencies
. Experience representing your team/technical area to senior management
. Experience in contributing to the definition and implementation of automation opportunities within an deployment/build environment
. Experience with lean methodologies and Six-Sigma or similar qualification
. Organizational and planning skills
. Broad understanding of infrastructure technologies installation and design
. Knowledge of network cabling, optic types, and test equipment
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

job_title: Data Center Capacity Delivery Leader, South East Asia
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Service (AWS) is a comprehensive, evolving, and growing business unit within Amazon.com which provides cloud services. Since early 2006, AWS has provided a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. AWS Infrastructure teams build scalable low-cost infrastructure for AWS cloud services in India. If you are interested in managing programs that deliver AWS cloud infrastructure in a challenging, high growth, fast paced and customer focused work environment then AWS may be the right fit for you. Do you have the business background, complex cross functional program management experience, financial expertise, legal/regulatory comprehension and technical understanding necessary to deliver end-to-end program Can you build, lead and inspire a team of talented builders to deliver stretched results Can you communicate effectively and find clarity in ambiguity and simplicity in complexity AWS has an immediate opening for a data center delivery leader in Singapore. In this role, you will lead a team of builders who work with cross functional teams to deliver usable data center capacity. Besides leading the team, you will partner with stakeholders across different functions to build mechanisms that will help your team to develop, document, manage and deliver infrastructure designs, implementation schedules and budgets. You will earn trust of your partners in your ability to solve complex issues and steer teams towards right direction to deliver results on-time and at-cost.
The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally strong communicator (both written and verbal), and possess more than 10 years of experience in management of highly technical and strategic programs experience in data center deployment programs will be a plus. A bachelor's degree in engineering and post graduate management degree are required. Candidates possessing a background in delivery leadership roles in architecture/design, mechanical/electrical engineering, software/hardware engineering, data center infrastructure/operations, and/or construction will have a distinct advantage.
Candidate must be comfortable managing remote teams, and possess ability to remove barriers to program success. Being able to create cross-functional matrix-based teams, establish trust with a variety of stakeholders across multiple time zones, manage capital budgets, eliminate non-value-add activity, design solutions, remove blockers, and find creative ways to accelerate delivery is a must.
If you meet these qualifications, exude passion, and enjoy the challenges of deploying highly technical and innovative projects at massive scale, this job is for you! Come, join, have fun and make history!

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree in technical streams (Or, any stream with technical experience)
. Master's degree in business
. More than 10 years of delivery experience with at least 4 years in leadership
. Experience in core project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, quality, along with risk and critical path management.
. Must be well organized and able to work effectively under cost and time pressure.
. Must be an inspiring leader
. Exceptional analytical, quantitative, communication, and presentation skills
. Must be able to make it simple for all stakeholders
. Must have required gravitas to communicate most effectively and respectfully at the highest levels internally and externally with partner and vendor organizations
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience in management of complex technology infrastructure programs (e.g. data centers, telecom, energy)
. Understanding of Information Technology, Cloud Computing concepts and specifically, AWS offerings.
. Understanding of ASEAN cloud computing and data center market and service provider.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Job summary
Do you have a passion for helping customers design large distributed systems Would you like to do this using the world's most advanced cloud computing technologies Do you have a knack for helping organizations understand application architectures and integration approaches, architecting advanced cloud-based solutions, and launching the build-out of those systems Are you one of those rare technologists with the consultative leadership skills to help guide major projects to success Come join the Amazon Web Services (AWS) team as a Principal Solutions Architect in Singapore!

As an Enterprise Accounts Solutions Architect you will be responsible for creating and driving the technical strategy for strategic customer accounts with a complex and multi-faceted relationship with AWS. You will partner with customers, AWS partners and AWS teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that provide solutions to solve customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services.

The right person will possess C-Level customer facing skills that will allow them to represent AWS well within the customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, and risk mitigation. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges. He/she will have these attributes:

*Be fun to work with.* Our company credo is Work hard. Have fun. Make history. As the right candidate, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge.

*Enjoy working with customers of all shapes and s.* You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for a diverse and challenging set of customers.

*Have a strong understanding of large scale cloud computing solutions.* You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills and developing new ones, so that you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions around systems and applications in the cloud. You regularly take part in deep-dive education and design exercises along with technical deep dive drive technical discussions to create world class systems in AWS for your customers.

The right individual will have experience in most of the following areas:

* Business acumen - Leads confidently conversations at C-level and one-down (e.g. director, vice president) on strategic and transformational business subjects
* Architecture & design - Brings a proven track record in delivering enterprise and infrastructure architectures, application and service designs for distributed, business critical applications.
* Industry expertise - Is a subject matter expert in one of the areas including Financial Services, eCommence, Telco, Airlines, Manufacturing.
Basic Qualifications :
* 10+ years of experience in design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications
* Experience in infrastructure, compute, containers, database and networking architecture for large scale environments
* Hands-on experience in application development and modernization including micro-service, and API driven-architectures
* Working knowledge on a broad range of technologies including Serverless, Big Data and Analytics, Machine learning, Containers e.g. Kubernetes, etc.
* Strong business acumen and interest to understand business problems and ability to explain the technology value proposition
* Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
* Technical degree required Computer Science or Math background highly desired.
Preferred Qualifications :
* AWS or other public clouds hands-on experience and certification
* Experience working in a pre-sales consulting role within the enterprise software market or Internet industries servicing enterprise customers

Job Description :
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and is the global cloud computing leader. To support our rapid growth, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and motivated people. If you'd like to help us be the best cloud services provider in the industry, this is your chance to make history. AWS HR is looking for dynamic self-starters graduating from MBA and master's programs in HR or related fields in 2022 to join the AWS HR leadership development program (HRLDP), a rotational experience designed set you on the path to HR leadership roles in AWS.

The AWS HRLDP develops high-potential MBA and master's graduates through a three-year rotational program across the AWS HR organization. You will be matched to challenging and high-visibility roles with rotation experiences customized to accelerate your development. You will have the opportunity to work across AWS business lines and functional areas in roles including HR Business Partner (HRBP), Builder Experience Team, Talent & Development, Compensation, Employee Relations, Workforce Planning & Analytics, and Inclusion, Diversity & Equity (ID&E). In these roles, you will drive talent agendas in partnership with senior business leaders and work on strategic programs that tackle critical business priorities. You will receive functional job training, leadership development workshops, mentorship and sponsorship, and a network of peers, program alumni, and leaders.

Basic Qualifications :

. 3+ years of full-time industry work experience, which occurred between graduation from your undergraduate program and prior to starting your MBA
. Graduating in 2022 from an MBA degree program
. Experience in human resources or related fields and/or knowledge of human resource theory (organizational effectiveness and dynamics, leadership, management theory, etc.)
Preferred Qualifications :
. Passion for building a career in Human Resources
. Experience working in a global or matrixed organization
. Strong business and HR acumen, including strong problem solving skills and critical thinking
. Project/Program Management Skills
. Experience in coaching senior leaders and managers
. Exceptional communication (written and verbal) and listening skills and the ability to relate to, influence, and coach employees of all levels in the organization

job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon's Legal Department is looking for a talented Contracts Manager based in Singapore to support Amazon Web Services, a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services is at the forefront of the cloud computing and service industry providing IT infrastructure services such as on-demand compute capacity, storage, content delivery, database services, browsers and more. This Contract Manager will primarily support Amazon Web Services Asia-Pacific sales and marketing initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for reviewing, drafting and negotiating IT agreements (including nondisclosure agreements, reseller contracts, services agreements, marketing contracts and other commercial contracts) as well as reviewing and providing guidance on RFI/RFPs, and local and regional marketing activities. Must have excellent written and oral communication skills as this position involves direct contact with principal business owners. The successful candidate must be inquisitive, enthusiastic about technology, enjoy working hard and being continually challenged, and demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations.

Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of contracts management, paralegal, or other comparable experience within a law firm or legal department
. Bachelor's Degree
Preferred Qualifications :
. In-house legal experience or law degree
. Experience reviewing, drafting and negotiating the legal terms of a broad range of standard commercial contracts
. Ability to work independently while being able to contribute successfully to cross-functional teams
. Excellent organizational skills, ability to manage multiple projects at once, follow through and meet deadlines
. Strong analytical and computer skills
. Experience working in a customer focused sales and marketing environment is also valuable

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

*Enjoy working with customers of all shapes and s.* You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for a diverse and challenging set of customers.

*Have a strong understanding of large scale cloud computing solutions.* You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills and developing new ones, so that you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions around systems and applications in the cloud. You regularly take part in deep-dive education and design exercises along with technical deep dive drive technical discussions to create world class systems in AWS for your customers.

The right individual will have experience in most of the following areas:

* Business acumen - Leads confidently conversations at C-level and one-down (e.g. director, vice president) on strategic and transformational business subjects
* Architecture & design - Brings a proven track record in delivering enterprise and infrastructure architectures, application and service designs for distributed, business critical applications.
* Industry expertise - Is a subject matter expert in one of the areas including Financial Services, eCommence, Telco, Airlines, Manufacturing.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 10+ years of experience in design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications
* Experience in infrastructure, compute, containers, database and networking architecture for large scale environments
* Hands-on experience in application development and modernization including micro-service, and API driven-architectures
* Working knowledge on a broad range of technologies including Serverless, Big Data and Analytics, Machine learning, Containers e.g. Kubernetes, etc.
* Strong business acumen and interest to understand business problems and ability to explain the technology value proposition
* Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
* Technical degree required Computer Science or Math background highly desired.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* AWS or other public clouds hands-on experience and certification
* Experience working in a pre-sales consulting role within the enterprise software market or Internet industries servicing enterprise customers
